text: Do NOT waste your money on this company.  I had a Precious Shihpoo who passed away this morning from congestive heart failure.  He was 11. I asked them how they knew he had  a congenial disease and not age related since they had no tests from when he was young.  Their response to this was that when they were writing the plan, they considered all the diseases that "might"be congenital and excluded them from coverage.  We are furious.  Please learn from our mistake and DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS COMPANY.

text: I have been with ASPCA since 2017 and was generally fine with them even though they tried to increase their price once in a while. However, just for this month, one of my cats got dental issue and had teeth extracted. I submitted a claim about it and ASPCA asked me for his medical records from 3/6/2021 to present. My vet had sent them records from April 2021 to present since that was when I started using this vet and I just did not go to any vet in March 2021. ASPCA still have the ‚Äúaction needed‚Äù warning on. When I called them, they said the just still need some record from that one missing month, which just literally nothing happened at that time since my cat was healthy and it was during COVID. And the reason they gave me was they need to make sure that my cat didn‚Äôt have dental issues before I started the plan with them, which as I mentioned at the very beginning, I have been with ASPCA since 2017! No matter what comes out during 2021, it should still be AFTER I got their plan! text:
Exactly what I feared would happen. You buy insurance and they find a way not to pay.

I purchased insurance in good faith. I followed the waiting period. On the first day coverage went into effect, my dog was diagnosed as having swallowed a foreign object. I did not wait to have my dog seen by the vet - I did not try to wait out the waiting period. You don't plan for this sort of thing and buy insurance weeks in advance.

The claims were denied because I told my vet my dog had a runny nose and eye discharge 2 days prior to the diagnosis by a vet. In other words, my claims were denied because I, as a lay person, observed cold/flu symptoms. I did not say she was bloated, I didn't say her stomach was tender. No gastric issues were observed until the day coverage went into effect - she threw up.
 
Any symptom will do to deny a claim. I believe a reasonable, non-veteranarian person would view the symptoms I saw as unrelated to a foreign object lodged in the small intestine. Luckily, the vet didn't rely on the symptoms I described.

The customer service wasn't great either. You have to initiate the appeal via writing. They won't initiate an appeal for you or let you speak with a supervisor.

I'll appeal, but my first encounter is exactly the opposite of the "Welcome to our Pet Family" message when I signed up and paid my premium. I do not believe they operate in good faith. Instead, they parsed the doctor notes and looked for a reason not to pay.

Right now, I would advise a hard pass on this coverage.
title: They look for ways not to pay

I am cancelling the insurance policies for both of dogs to try to offset some of the surgery expense. Overall, the people are very pleasant, but I prefer an insurance company that is willing to pay when it's their time.

text: I don‚Äôt make reviews often, but I had to give credit where it‚Äôs due. I put off buying insurance for my cat, and one random night bought a policy through ASPCA with basically no research (very much not like me) and thank god I did. Shortly after my cat began having asthma and later had been diagnosis with a heart condition as well. Thankfully due to the insurance I was able to give him the care he needed such as the cardiologist appointments, inhalers, medications, etc. without worry. Every single claim went through without and issue and posted into my account. Processing would sometimes take a bit but I never had any issues with a single claim. Sadly a few weeks ago he passed away very unexpectedly. Dealing with the  emergency vet bills, cremation services and just being completely heart broken I couldn‚Äôt do much. A week later I finally submitted the claim, not even bothering to look through any information on what would be covered and didn‚Äôt think twice. I put off cancelling the account (it made me too sad) but when I went on it was closed out for me which was a very big emotional relief for me. Today when I came home I received a handwritten letter from ASPCA with their condolences on my loss. This was just something I did not expect, but really did mean so much. Loosing him has been such a struggle, but I cannot be more grateful that I was able to spend the time I did with him and never worry about choosing between his care or my financial well-being. I could not recommend them more.
title: Best Decision I Made

text: I read all the great reviews so I was eager to enroll. My dogs are completely healthy but needed their annual checkup/shots and a dental cleaning. I pay $186 a month for my pets and that is taken out immediately from my account without delay,  but when it comes to reviewing a claim it has taken almost 3 weeks before ASPCA even looked at it. Now they want a complete history of my pets. I could understand if they are checking for pre-existing conditions, but this claim applies only to the add on benefit of annual shots, teeth cleaning, standard checkup, etc. it has nothing to do with a potential previous health condition plus they are completely healthy. Now after three weeks ASPCA can no longer process my claim without obtaining previous medical records. My pets are not injured or sick so why is the claim on hold??? Also‚Ä¶ if you paid for premium services when your pet is seen by a Veterinarian, but then decide to go to a less expensive plan, the entire previous claim made under the premium plan will be applied to the new less coverage plan even though you paid for premium services during your pets visit. Lastly,  if you are not satisfied and want to choose a different provider or just cancel a policy, there is no online option and you must contact customer service by email. This tells me they will do everything they can to delay termination of a contract. Who knows how long a response will take‚Ä¶ Im sure it will be delayed until after your next premium is deducted..To cancel you also have to provide a reason for canceling‚Ä¶it‚Äôs none of their business! If I want to cancel and stop the auto deduction from my credit card or bank it should be straight forward and easy. Others may be happy with this service but I see this as just another big ‚Äúnon profit‚Äù scam to separate you from your money without providing quality service.
title: Better check the fine print!

text:
Previously, I reviewed ASPCA, and was applauded at how the company swiftly, willing responded to my concerns on how claims were being handled. In the mist of all the commotion, our sweet, elderly furry family member became very ill, and we lost him.  After mourning  
his lost, we encountered the warmest email from ASPCA, and they went above and beyond to help us to finish his claims, even after he was gone.  Sometimes it is easier to make a hasty opinion about a company, until you have to deal directly with them.  After dealing directly with ASPCA Pet Insurance, I had to come back to Trust Pilot, and make it right for my deceased furry family member.  They are a superb company, after you understand their process.  I respect and thank them for acknowledging my loss. When we or if we get another furry family member, ASPCA, will be the first company we will use to insure our loved one.  Two Thumbs Up, and Thank You for restoring our faith in companies who are still trying to stay strong and please the clienteles.  Blessings to you.
Regards,
Emily
title: Sweet Redemption! Apology Excepted!

text: I have four pets on this insurance plan. I have the accident and illness plan. So far, not a single claim for any of the 3 pets for whom I have submitted claims has received any reimbursement. Originally, the explanation was that the Vet had not heard back from the veterinarian. This was for three different veterinarians. So, the FAQs say to submit medical records. I submitted all of their medical records and then all of their regular bills so the insurance company would have the entire picture of each pet. Now, the excuse for not reimbursing a dime for any of the pets for any of their claims is "other exclusions apply". I am quite disappointed that I have spent so much money, thinking my 4 pets were covered. Our pets are a young dog, middle aged dog, and two middle aged cats. The claims have run from injured leg, skin infections, and illness. Nothing has been covered. One of our dogs just had surgery for an injury. I'll submit it, with no expectation of reimbursement, like the other claims we've submitted. I am currently on the search for a real insurance company. I am so disappointed that the SPCA would be affiliated with such a company.
title: It's a scam...I have four pets on this insurance‚Ä¶

text:
Absolute ripoff, like most insurance companies. I have two young German shepherd dogs (under 3 years old) so I wanted to get a good pet insurance while they are young. I did my research like most, though with insurance it is difficult because most reviews are on sites they pay or their own website.

I had 2 claims come up during my time in having the pet insurance. I‚Äôm both instances, the issue is they will do everything in their power to deny the claim in the hopes you will give up trying to get reimbursed. In our cases, they kept saying that ‚Äúafter multiple attempts, they were unable to obtain the necessary medical records to process the claim.‚Äù So I went ahead and called my vet hospital to verify if the information was sent. Not only was the information was sent, but twice! After multiple frustrating calls to ASPCA, they were able to ‚Äúfind‚Äù the documents, but it always seemed to conveniently found a way to miss them or they claimed they don‚Äôt receive them. I think what really goes on is that if they can‚Äôt find a good reason to deny it medically, they will say they can‚Äôt obtain some record and just hope the person submitting the claim will give up. Well we didn‚Äôt give up and it took a few tries but we got our money and cancelled the insurance, never looking back.
title: Absolute ripoff

text: When attempting to make an appointment at a vet's office, I was asked if I would like to pay for pet insurance to cover the upcoming visit. I decided to go ahead and spring for it. I was given a confirmation that I had coverage from 10/17/2023 to 10/17/2024. Unfortunately, something happened on 10/17/2023 that I had to take my dog in for. Nearly $500 later, I opened the app to file my first claim and was told that, although it says I'm covered starting on the 17th, I could not make claims for any veterinary visit that occurred before 10/31/2023, which was not stated in the initial sign-up. If I am paying for coverage starting on a certain date, I expect that coverage to start on that certain date--not two weeks later.
title: Misleading: Coverage Starts Two Weeks After it Claims to Start

text:
As someone who has worked in customer service for nearly 20 years, I am beyond disgusted. If I could rate this with zero stars, I would. Not only does getting a claim processed take forever (five weeks in currently and NOTHING), but the app never works! I changed the policy for my animals before the renewal date six separate times through the app and website on four different devices including a phone, mac laptop, ipad, and pc... yet for some reason only part of those changes went through. I repeatedly sent emails/called about this issue before the renewal date yet nothing was fixed and I never even got a reply through email. Over the phone, I was belittled and spoken too as if I was incompetent. When asking about the long wait times for claims and how to submit them (their app sucks and things are worded in misleading ways) the first customer service person I spoke to laughed and said they were short handed and that maybe I should work there if I wanted to help speed up the claims. They also explained the process of what I needed to do for my issues, directly after I told them in detail that I had already done what they were explaining.. So they just didn't even listen to what I was saying and talked over me to explain what I just told them I had already tried. They then brushed me off and told me I would get a call back from a member of the service team. No one ever called. When trying to handle it for the probably 20th time after three weeks of the issue still not being resolved, they asked me for proof of my emails and calls because they apparently have no record of them in their system. (this is a lie) Unfortunately, my email has an auto delete of five days for sent emails and I did not expect them to be so hard to work with (Its Aspca! They are supposed to care!) so I didn't save back ups. I even said I have screenshots of calls placed with my cellphone and their time frames, but because they apparently have "no record" of them and I didn't think I would have to record my own calls to them, that it won't be taken into account at all. This is now a mistake I will never forget. So now my coverage is inaccurate for what I wanted and needed and my cat will have insufficient insurance. Due to this issue I asked them to halt the processing for any new transaction for the annual payment while I check out my options with other carriers for my cat. They charged me anyway, directly after telling me I had a few weeks to decide and that they will halt a new transaction. Apparently it will take several weeks to get the funds back and I'll likely have to waste more time on hold and take off work to do so. Worst customer service I think I've ever experienced. 

To top it off, one of the changes I repeatedly tried to establish was the cancellation of one dog. My best friend of 14 years passed away and no one from this company would even give me the courtesy of replying to cancel her portion of the policy.  Each time on the phone when I mentioned this, the response I got was clinical and cold, as well as skeptical and asking me if I was "sure that I'd emailed about it." They charged my account to renew a policy for my dead friend after completely ignoring me and I didn't even get so much as a "sorry." To top this off, after never replying to my email about my girl, they sent me a condolences letter in the mail and *wait for it* STILL CHARGED ME for her policy, while still not even bothering to reply. Not only am I having to deal with all of this while grieving, but they treated me like an idiot as well. I had to throw a literal fit on the phone just to get the policy of my lost friend removed because it was passed the renewal date- through no fault of my own and with weeks of me trying to get them to follow through.

This company is fraudulent and shameful. I can't even begin to describe how much this increased my pain and distress while grieving. They made me feel stupid and taken advantage of in every possible way. And its not even very good insurance! Its bare bones with coverage with high as heck premiums. I'm tempted to look into a lawsuit for pain and suffering.
title: cold liars with zero accountability and an app that doesn't work

Needless to say, I regret sinking so much money into their bogus insurance package. Will be following up with the Virginia Bureau of Insurance.

text:
First off, ASPCA surprisingly does not care about you or your pet. If claim processing times take a month...HIRE MORE PROCESSORS. 
Secondly, This insurance is only for the upper middle class to wealthy, the people that can afford to wait 1-2 months for the reimbursement money to come through and still have enough to pay for 4-figure vet bills. If you are an avg income, you will be going into serious debt with Care Cash, your credit score will tank from not being able to repay your credit cards in a timely manner or you may be faced with having to euthanize your pet because the bills cannot be paid by that money you were waiting to be reimbursed for. I have been a customer for 3 years. I have paid all of my monthly payments on time. I have called 2x and the customer service rep said, "oh we will put a special note on your claim so the processes know to look at yours next." a single income household still waiting for my submitted documents to even be reviewed. My golden has a tumor found in his chest cavity. I wanted to save him so I drove him to the local university to be operated on. The oncology and surgery bill ran me $8,000 and the on-going chemo treatments are about $555. I have used my saving, started a GoFundMe, and have been selling possessions to help cover all the bills. What i cannot cover is going on credit cards. I have been waiting for even one of my submitted documents to leave the "queued" phase for 30 days. My dog still needs 4 more chemo treatments and all the blood panels from the local vet. The $4,000 I am waiting to be reimbursed could save my dogs life as I am at all my credit limits. Please, save yourself the tears and anguish of sitting on the claims page of ASPCA refreshing and refreshing, thinking that you are a priority and find another Pet Insurance.
title: Your pet will die before you get the reimbursement you need to help it

text: I cannot say enough about how grateful I am for ASPCA pet insurance. When we brought home our Cavalier King Charles Spaniel at 8 weeks old, a friend who is a vet tech recommended ASPCA insurance, and we purchased it literally the day after we brought her home, even though she was seemingly healthy and perfect. She‚Äôs still perfect, but she does have seizures, which started when she was around 7 months old. Thanks to ASPCA insurance we were able to say yes to all of her bloodwork, hospital stays, MRI, spinal tap, medications, rechecks, and prescription food and not worry about the cost. She is our baby and I honestly don‚Äôt know what we would have done without insurance. The claims process is simple and direct deposit is wonderful. Additionally, the premium does not go up based on your usage!! They only base it on breed/age/etc. After filing thousands of dollars of claims, I was terrified to open our renewal notice. But it is only going up by $3 a month!!! Thank you thank you thank you for taking care of my sweet French Fry. I have donated to ASPCA my entire life and I will continue to do so.
title: Grateful doesn‚Äôt even come close!

text: I have had ASPCA insurance for my cat for several years. I have no complaints whatsoever with their claims processing or customer service. I have had to appeal a couple of claims and have had a positive outcome. However, the annual increases in policy costs are absolutely unconscionable and the explanations for the increases are generalized and not sufficiently supported. My premium increase 30% last year and this year will increase an additional 50%! There is no reasonable justification for such increases year after year, except that they can get away with it. If your pet has preexisting conditions, they will not be covered by another company. The only option the policyholder has to mitigate the cost is to reduce coverage in some way.  Hardly a customer-friendly policy.
title: Premium Increases Are Insane

I care about my little one very much and I had lost my previous dog due to terminal incurable illness so i decided to get my new rescue an insurance. After reviewing the policies and many customer reviews( i am very sad that I haven't read the yelp reviews before) I chose the ASPCA insurance.

I have to wait already 2 months to be reimbursed for the damn shots. I have a prime preventative plan for my dog. And my claim was considered inelegible for the reimbursement BECAUSE IT EXCEEDS THE LIMIT: ATTN to the logic- i pay 70$ a month for your damn insurance and i will not be reimbursed my maximum for rabies vac which is 25$ BECAUSE I PAID 30$ at vetco. ARE U CRAZY AND HIRE PPL WHO HAVE NO CLUE HOW YOUR POLICY WORKS? 

The customer service is unhelpful at all, they are very polite etc. but i don't need to be asked how I and my dog are doing, i have friends and family to ask me that. The insurance company has only to proceed the claims the right way and give the reimbursement according to my plan. That's it. 
If your representative will respond and offer me to call the customer service- I HAVE ALREADY SPENT AN HOUR ON THE LINE WITH YOUR SERVICE AND IT DID NOT HELP THE CASE.

Would never recommend anyone to use that company

text:
Signed up for this insurance for my dog several months ago because they stated that cover well pet exams and accidents. Well, that‚Äôs just what happened, my dog got his nail caught in a grate and it was torn off. Took him to the vet ER and it cost a pretty penny. Filed the claim , sent all the records of procedures and cost, as requested and they paid me $0.00. 
I pay my premium every month on time for my pup and this is what the coverage covers, or should I doesn‚Äôt cover? Guess I needed to read the fine fine print. 
Needless to say I will be looking for new pet insurance for my pup.
title: Not What You Think.

text: I've been an ASPCA Pet Insurance member for several years and through numerous medical emergencies with my dogs, Miss Molly, Ollie, Merlin, and Benji. This included an expensive surgery to repair vertebra injury and paralysis with my Diva Dachshund Miss Molly. Never once did I have a problem with claims and payments. I used another top 5 brand before ASPCA Pet Insurance and was completely disappointed in services and claims and even ventured away from ASPCA Pet Insurance this past summer after losing Miss Molly and Merlin within 75 days of each other. I Went with two different Top 5 brands and both were so unorganized and unprofessional; I was still getting requests to sign with them weeks after paying fees and submitting registration information. ASPCA Pet Insurance is simple, inexpensive, EXTREMELY courteous and professional. Their APP and Member Center are easy to navigate and claims processing and payment is easier than most.  Reimbursements may take a few days depending on uniqueness of claims submitted so please be patient as "your claim" is not the "only claim" being processed.  I'm paying less than $70/month for two dogs with wellness plans and $4000 each in annual coverage at 80% Reimbursements and $250 deductibles each. Extremely inexpensive and well worth the investment. My dogs are my family. They're my responsibility and MY life. Thanks ASPCA Pet Insurance for all you have provided to me and my family.
title: Look no further. Use ASPCA Pet Insurance

text:
I have been reluctant to write a review, but feel that I need to let other pet parents know about my consistent experiences.  I am beyond frustrated. The biggest frustration is that what ASPCA states that they will claim is often denied.  One example (of many), an RX food used to treat a medical condition (not a general maintenance) is CLEARLY laid out in my plan, but is denied when I submit. Today I‚Äôm told that it needs to be an RX medication food- even though that is nowhere in the policy.  My internal medicine vet wrote a long letter explaining how this is a specific treatment, and it is still denied.  It is a constant struggle to have ASPCA cover what is clearly listed in the policy, and when you submit an appeal, it further delays ALL processing.

 The normal processing times exceed a month when there are no extenuating circumstances.  I get frequent standard emails apologizing for the long delays, with ASPCA acknowledging the severe delays.  I just called about claims and the customer service rep was adamant they process claims in 7-10 business days, essentially telling me that he knew better about processing times instead of my actual experience and the acknowledgement from ASPCA via email apology.  

The the past few months, every time I call I‚Äôm given a different answer to the same question.  This is beyond frustrating and I am considering canceling my plan so I can give my dog the best care without the hassle and frustration every month.  I hope other pet parents seriously consider these experiences.
title: I have been reluctant to write a‚Ä¶

text: I have paid on my policy for 5 years for my dog and my daughter's dog. My daughter had to move to CA for work which never seemed to be a problem filing claims for her dog. Earlier this year I called with a question and said my daughters dog was in CA and he had had a couple claims. My dog has never had a claim in those 5 years. They said since my daughter moved that both dogs could not be on the same policy. So they cancelled my dog in March 2023 the second I told them she had to move. I turned in a claim in July 2023 for for labs for slightly elevated liver enzymes that he has before (the vet said don't worry, they were not that high) and since he had to start his waiting period over, after 5 years of paying, ASPCA claim it was a pre-existing condition and will not pay. This is wrong of the company. I will cancel this policy as they just cancelled my dog and erased 5 years of payments and no preexisting conditions, without any claims. Guess there isn't anything I can do, but buyer beware. They will find any excuse not to pay a claim.

text:
Poor Website and Customer Service

When signing up, the website was very glitchy (e.g. kept switching the animal I was signing up for from horse to cat) and took a lot of persistence to even get to the checkout. Then when I went to pay, the site refused to accept any credit card I entered (it kept throwing a security code error, even when I input the security code correctly, and even when I tried multiple credit cards). I finally switched to using my bank account to pay just to complete the transaction. My bank account was promptly debited for the price of the insurance plan. Then, three days later I see I my bank account was debited a second time for a slightly different amount. I received absolutely no communication about this second charge. I e-mailed Customer Service and received no reply. I called Customer Service and they told me this was "probably" a change in premium and that I should "probably" be receiving a refund for the original premium. They told me to just wait a week and call back if I hadn't received a credit. This is a completely unacceptable answer -- I've been effectively charged twice, with the money taken directly out of my bank account -- and no one knows anything. And they essentially told me to just wait a while! I seriously hope this experience is not an indication of the service I can expect with the insurance product itself. Really regretting switching to ASPCA.
title: Poor Website and Customer Service

text:
We had the preventative basic plan because the vast majority of what we need for our pet is preventative care. Turns out, effectively nothing we do (e.g., vaccines, preventative flea/tick meds, etc.) are actually covered. Beyond that, the premium we've paid annually would have barely been less than what we would have just paid out-of-pocket for the services themselves.

In summary, the coverage is presented misleadingly, the prices are astronomical for what is covered, and customer service has been no help at all.

We cancelled coverage, and even if we ever want pet insurance again, we'll never consider ASPCA Pet Insurance again. Buyer be warned.
title: Overpriced, misleadingly-presented coverage, and terrible customer service

text:
Today I cancelled my complete coverage plan for my cat due to the difficulty in getting my claim paid.  After two plus weeks after submitting, I received an email apologizing for the delay "call volume higher than usual...", then another email, "more information is needed ..." this in regard to a prior vet visit for specific dates that did not actually include any visit to that vet.  I followed up explaining that the dates did not include this visit (no wonder the prior vet did not reply), but ASPCA Insurance denied my very recent claim even though my current vet provided requested information.  It's as though I hadn't said a thing, they completely ignored my contention that they had asked for dates of service to a former vet when that vet did not treat my cat during these dates.  Why did I bother to explain! 

I am requesting ASPCA Insurance revisit this claim and acknowledge their mistake.  It is easier to get my own health care needs reimbursed, than it is for my cat!  Very disappointing outcome.
title: Today I cancelled my coverage‚Ä¶

text:
Brand new to the company so can‚Äôt comment on claims, etc. One sales rep was super helpful and caring, provided multiple quotes, but not one I should have considered equally. I bought through broker as I already had been working them prior to deciding on ASPCA.  I bought policy on 7/13 so still in waiting period, but learned that there was a more cost effective Deductible with 100% reimbursement that is not found without calling and asking for the quote. On 7/18, four days after my purchase the representative was very nice but could not change or adjust my policy without cancelling and starting all over with new policy. I was a bit disappointed but decided to leave the policy as originally purchased, and was told I can change next year. So the only reason for 4 stars as they would change my original purchase. 

 I post this mostly to say CALL and speak to someone and ASK for ALL your options deductibles, reimbursement amounts, etc. as all are not on website. I missed finding on a the brokers website also as it seems the only way I could have found was to select $1000 deductible then see the 100% reimbursement amount come up.  Otherwise their site also shows a 90% max reimbursement for ASPCA. Very tricky if a first time shopper.  Just know that you may have to wait till policy renewal to change or maybe even need the policy re-written to make a change.

Otherwise, in doing a lot of research I chose ASPCA over others as they seem to be the most inclusive coverage wise for me
and the best fit for my new guy. I hope to have a good long term relationship with ASPCA Pet Insurance.
title: Not all options on Website/Call and ask for all offerings

text: In November of last year we decided to get pet insurance for our dog. Soon after, she was playing in the snow and tore her ACL which was listed as covered under her policy. We took her to the vet and they recommended surgery but we decided to hold off and hoped it would heal on its own. Unfortunately, it didn't and five months later she had surgery. All of her claims were denied due to her ACL tear being labeled as an "illness". The vet wrote a letter confirming the date of injury, type of injury and clarifying that it couldn't be an illness as it was related to an injury. I have called countless times, written countless emails, and now am consulting with an attorney. If the policy specifically claims ACL injuries are covered, they should be covered. She had absolutely zero prior issues with her ACL, never limped or showed any signs of problems prior.
title: Denials that go against their policy

text: I learned about ASPCA Health Insurance through a partnership it had with the Virginia Association of Realtors.  The Policy is supposed to cover some preventative services, as well as illnesses/emergencies.  After more than a year when my labrador had several ear infections and allergies, as well as her well-dog check-up, only one of her claims was paid for $130 out of a $600 bill.  As a human health policy expert, with many years of experience working in the Congress on Medicare and federal health issues, I can honestly say that ASPCA's advertised benefits are not honest. ASPCA is definitely not worth the premium.

text:
Our former pet insurance company (been with them over 20 years with other pets) tripled our Bunny Dog's rate to $500.00 monthly. I was shocked and asked why. After several communications I was left not knowing why this happened. I ask, who can afford that for one animal? 
I researched pet insurance companies for weeks and each time I did a comparison for the needs of our little Bunny, ASPCA came out on top. 
Very easy to sign up, acceptable waiting periods, I understand about pre-existing conditions, their reputation is solid, believe in their philosophy about animals. Overall a good experience.
title: Leaving Healthy Paws after 20 years, going to ASPCA

text:
I adopted a dog from the local SPCA and immediately purchased a policy through ASPCA Pet Health Insurance. My new dog somehow injured his right shoulder, starting as a small scratch turning into an open wound requiring a visit to the vet hospital. My adoption agreement included an one-time no fee wellness exam which I used for his visit. A couple of weeks later he developed a serious skin condition in a different area that he would scratch at obsessively. This began with a small area on his neck that seemed manageable. A day or so later his neck started to swell and the skin was terribly inflamed to the point of concern. I called the vet hotline and spoke with someone who after hearing my description of the issue suggested we go to the hospital. An appoint was made for the next day. During that night my dog had done serious damage to himself an area the size of a plum had erupted and became an ugly open wound. Over the next 3 weeks we had been to the hospital almost every other day because none of the medical staff could figure out the cause and the wound continues to worsen. I hadn't had this dog a month and a half and he was sick with no understanding why. Although I had adopted the dog from the same organization that was treating him I ultimately spent over $2000 in less than a month. Each visit to the vet was no less than $300 and as much as $575. I am retired and collect Social Security benefits of just over $1700 each month. Fortunately I have a medical specific credit card that could be used for vet care. As the charges for each visit was growing into the hundreds of dollars, I shared with the hospital staff my financial capacity was quickly becoming an issue I could not continue to fund. Even though I adopted this dog only a couple of week prior to his developing a critical need for medical attention from the very organization I was not offered any sort of financial relief. The day I brought this dog into my home I promised him I was 100% committed to being his loving forever human. Each visit to the vet over these couple of weeks would wreck havoc on my heart and soul as I would be desperate to find answers for how to ease his discomfort along with having to hand over hundreds of dollars over and over. 
My total and profound disappointment with this insurance company came after I had submitted claims for the care my dog received. I did not submit a request for the injury to his should for the first and second visit. The first had been comped and I paid the $200 plus for the follow up reexam. So what this insurance company does is deny the claim for treatment of the wound on his neck. This insurance company asked for the dogs medical records, which I immediately supplied to them for review. Although each situation my dog was facing were two completely different issues on completely different areas of his body, but because his first injury was inside the 14 waiting period. I did not ask them to reimburse any amount toward the first. I submitted claims for the treatment received for the problems that were well outside the 14 wait period. This insurance company decided they would not be responsible for reimbursement of any amount having assigned their code 51 pre-existing condition to my claim.
I have concluded this insurance company is a greedy, uncompassionate and misleading collective of people a scam willing to take the premium I pay in good standing every month. When I was up against a crisis that was emotionally devastating and financially unmanageable asking for their supports they basically inform me that they love my money, that I am a fool for ever thinking they had any intention of attempting to make me even the tiniest bit whole. 
I've given everyone more money than I have because I care greatly about my dog's well being and am fully committed to his care. In the end, this insurance company let me know that I was stupid for thinking I was being a responsible human to this rescued dog by sending them money every month. 
This insurance company is a scam and I am a sucker for putting my faith in them. 
My dog has completely recovered and I am truly grateful and a small bit relieved. I have lived on peanut butter and water for the last two weeks because I didn't have money to feed both me and my dog after giving hundreds and hundreds of dollars towards his medical bills.
I have decided this insurance company is not a place that I believe deserve my time or attention and have spent days trying to find how to cancel my policy with them through their member portal. I am quite sure if the only way to cancel a policy is speaking with anyone at this insurance company by phone someone would experience complete emotional collapse. I have opened a special savings for my dog to place the money that would
title: 7/29/2023 UPDATE: I have reached out to an attorney‚Ä¶

We step $450 on an emergency visit for our dog which they say has %80 coverage but we only received 70 dollars. This company is a joke and I feel so sorry for anyone that wastes their money on insurance that doesn‚Äôt cover anything but death. I could have used their 50 dollar monthly payment to cover almost the same amount as they did for the visit. So Sad to see such a horrible waste of money! Good luck to anyone that still gives them money, just wait till you have to use the insurance, they‚Äôll do anything they can to not do their jobs.

text:
Filed a claim based on an estimate from my vet. Got an invoice later that day but found that I could not add docs to the claim. About a week later my account showed the claim completed and reimbursement sent via direct deposit to my bank account. I assumed that ASPCA had contacted vet and verified the actual bill. 5 business days go by nothing in my bank. Call up customer service and rep tells me they do not pay on estimates ..I have to file another claim with the actual invoice. I say " but the computer says the original claim has already been paid.."  Maddening!! 
I have filed another claim ...now I expect to hear that their records show they have already paid that claim.. 
Even more  maddening!!
Pet insurance is just not worth it..I have paid way, way, way more in premiums than If i had just paid cash out of pocket to the vet and on top of this is all this opaque bureaucratic nonsense designed to make  it difficult to get a legit claim paid. Don't get me started on the customer service wait times!!
title: Overall frustrating experience...

text:
FYI the business reply below says ‚Äúget in touch via this email‚Äù yes this is the same email they blatantly ignore me on and I reference in my review. It is just bots replying to reviews to keep their scores high. Look at the other 1 star reviews on here! They're telling the truth. See how ASPCA responds to everyone telling them to call a number that no one answers just so they look like they're engaging on here. They are shady!
My experience has been that after ASPCA failing to process my claim within the contracted time and after exhausting my good graces with excuses they they proceeded to deny my claims because as they claim "multiple attempts were made to obtain medical records". This is despite the fact my vet had sent them everything they requested multiple times and I too had forwarded things to them. I made numerous attempts to email them and they would send cut and paste responses refusing to even acknowledge my formal complaints. Never once did they call or email my vet, get back to me (I on the other hand spent at least 4 time on hold for 30 minutes where no one answered). They just kept sending requests for records they clearly had. Even in our email chain it was clear that they had received the necessary documents. There was no getting sense from them. I wonder if they are bots or AI. I can't think humans would be that deliberately obtuse and act in such bad faith again and again. They pay a lot of money clearly to "impartial" insurance review sites to silence honest reviews like this one and flood the internet with reviews from fake industry professionals comparing the coverage instead of genuine customer experiences.
title: Avoid! Blatant bad faith company

text: I have had this insurance for nearly 15 years on my dogs.  The experiences I have had over that time with ASPCA have been disappointing.  Which honestly, is quite an understatement. When I knew I was in trouble was when they would not cover my girls double patella surgery.  They kept insisting she was a purebred because that breed was prone to that, they don't cover it.  She was not.  Once that was fixed, then they said they wanted the last 2 years of her medical records. I did that.  Then they dug deeper from my vet and found from when she was a little puppy, that a vet said she thought she had weak patellas and to keep an eye on it. BAM, that's all they wanted and my surgery was not covered. That was AFTER I was told they only go back 2 years. I appealed and lost.  Then both my dogs ended up with liver issues later and need liver medication for the rest of their life,  or they will die.  They wouldn't cover it because the medicine is a supplement. And the icing on the cake? They both had Cushings (one passed on now) which is a lifelong disease. I knew I needed help with this! And I have the Continuing Care policy as well. Here is the horrible thing.  You have a "lifelong" limit. Mine is over,  so now I'm paying out of pocket for her expenses on her Cushings and anything that goes with it. Along with all her liver meds.  I've almost hit the maximum on the whole policy,  so why keep paying for something I can't use. I'm so disappointed and wish I would have done things differently. My dogs were siblings and had many of the same health issues,  which was unfortunate for me,  but my one girl,  despite that,  is going strong at 15!
title: I have had this insurance for nearly 15‚Ä¶

text: Worst experience ever. My dog had an accident in 2013 which was a minor bull of 158$ which never got reimbursed. He now had an accident which lead to brain damage either stroke or tumor which as I didn‚Äôt want to put him under anesthesia for MRI couldn‚Äôt be ruled out and he deteriorated in health within a week so I had to put him to sleep and the insurance says pre existent condition(‚Äúillness‚Äù they called it. As if I would go for an ‚Äúillness‚Äù to the ED!)! A dog that ran and walked daily 1-2 hours and jumped 2-3 feet high without any elevated blood levels or any medications! He had head trauma from his accident when he fell and they say ‚Äúillness‚Äù or  ‚Äúpreexisting‚Äù condition! I paid 12 years, never anything after the accident january 2013 and now at his last accident for which I took him to the hospital trying to save his life which cost him his life within a week they say ‚Äúillness‚Äù and it IS NOT covered under their ‚Äúaccident‚Äù insurance!!! Worst insurance ever. Absolutely horrible and nobody on the phone to help. I wish I did never sign up for this crap and had saved the money I would still have extra money over from what I paid them and still have covered all the expenses I had now. This insurance is a fraud.
title: Worst experience ever

text: Signed up after hesitation about pet insurance due to everything being considered a pre-existing condition. Didn‚Äôt receive anything in the mail until a month later as inaccurately described by sales. The coverage I signed for says it starts mid month the previous month which is completely inaccurate. I also recently submitted my first four claims. Naturally they accepted my own money towards the deductible but when it comes to ASPCA insurance covering anything my intuition was correct in that everything is going to be considered a pre-existing condition. For example, my pet received an antibiotic injection and they stated this was injection was not reimbursable because it was for a pre-existing condition. When I questioned why the injection portion of the claim was not reimbursable they stated it was due to a pre-existing condition. They stated it was due to my pet having tartar which could lead to gingivitis even though gingivitis wasn‚Äôt listed in my pet‚Äôs record. An antibiotic injection is not given for tartar! Pet insurance in general is a total waste of money, you‚Äôre paying money every month to have useless insurance and for ASPCA insurance to deny this claim is ridiculous, especially since there was nothing in the medical record leading to a pre-existing condition. Love how the employees try to put a positive spin on the insurance though. ASPCA insurance and any other pet insurance will always try to find loop holes and grey areas to keep your money. Not a good investment in my opinion.
title: Useless Pet Insurance

text: I have had two policies in the past neither covered annual exams. My dog‚Äôs insurance was a great investment and helped greatly when she developed an illness. I had my cats insurance from @2012 to 2019. In December of 2019 at a vet visit the office noted we should consider prescription cat food for developing kidney disease. When we took him back to the vet a few months later the vet took blood work and recommended we start a medicine for his kidneys. When I submitted the bill it was denied and I was told it was a continuing illness from the previous year and was not covered. I still don‚Äôt understand the denial. Six years without a claim and then told it was not covered. We have been paying for meds and now infusions three years later and have no insurance coverage. I do not think the very limited coverage was worth much once a problem develops in an  older cat. Money wasted for six years. I thought I had him covered for catastrophic illnesses but evidently it all has to happen in the same year. After talking with a rep I was told that the coverage really wouldn‚Äôt cover anything anymore since the kidney disease was life threatening  I cancelled after many years with only a claim for one prescription being sent. Very disappointed!
title: I have had two policies in the past‚Ä¶

text:
I am on my second year of Accident + Colic Coverage on my 4 horses, and recently added Complete/Accident + Illness on my 2 cats as well. This is my very first claim.
My horse recently sustained bone trauma that unfortunately caused a portion of the coffin bone to became devitalized and turn into a sequestrum. Super straightforward accident/injury, right? Wrong, apparently. My small claim for radiographs and antibiotics was denied, since apparently"no eligible accident took place."
A different claim on my cat (extraction of several teeth with resorptive lesions) was denied because she previously had lesions on a DIFFERENT tooth (which was removed/cured), FOUR YEARS AGO. Apparently damage to one tooth (even if that tooth is removed) counts as a pre-existing condition on other, previously healthy teeth... Make it make sense. This claim also took over a month to process and included the company repeatedly asking me for my cat's vet records - from my EQUINE vet.
Garbage customer service, garbage insurance. I will NOT be renewing coverage and I will be warning every pet and horse owner I know to stay far, far away.
title: Straightforward injury claim denied

text:
The short story: 
$556 insurance: $765 charges: $205 reimbursement. 
(and my insurance goes up to $628 in a few days which was news that was not emailed to me and was buried in the website.)

$1,116 expended. With insurance. Without insurance: $765.

I understand that insurance is for the what-if situations and you often don't get back what you pay in premiums. But I paid roughly $880 for a what-if situation (surgery) and was reimbursed for less than ONE FOURTH. 

The long story:
*Bill for hot spots: $117 - not covered because the dog had previously had hot spots. (That amount is not figured in my calculations.)
*Bill for bordatella. Not reimbursed -- not considered preventative care $30 charge; ($25 allowed amount)
*Bill for $696 for surgery -- removing a weird tumor on dog's leg. Allowed amount: $180
*Bill for pre-op blood test -- $`171. Not covered because of on-going treatment. Huh? The growth shows up, and this is considered on-going treatment, though it's preparation for the surgery?
*Bill for wellness exam: $67 Reimbursement: $25.

I don't think I'll renew.
title: Not worth it even though customer service folks were nice

I filed a claim and the support staff was very nice, no issues with them at all. My dog has had issues in May with his stomach but our clinic have not been able to figure out why he was throwing. It's a French Bulldog and they tend to have digestive issues and he was fine until Sept and had a bout with his stomach and we call and could not get into see the vet until Dec whcih at that point they prescribed about 4 meds and stated to keep him on his strict diet  which we have. Our bill was $336 and once I submitted the claim they needed med records which the vet provided and at that point they decide it was "pre-existing condition" which is a crock of "you know what " I called and got the standard well he a condition back in May so unfortunately it's not 180 days from the 
  "pre-existing condition" so we can't take anything off your deductible and all the meds will not be covered. I tried in vein to explain but of course no assistance and I'm trying to explain you take my $143 every month and the 1st claim I submit is denied because a dog can't throw up for 180 days or your out of luck. BUYER BEWARE! I really thought his was a great way to protect our dog I assure they didn't ask me any questions nor did they ask my vet. Just requesting medical records does not indicate it's related. Ask questions many before you sign on.

text: Unfortunately due to the heartless decision of this so called insurance company we are having to make the tough choice right now of whether to put our cat Woody down. This cat has been a part of our young family for 2.5 years. We took him to the hospital back in September due to a problem that he had with one of his knees causing him not be able to walk. He also had to have surgery at that time to remove a blockage in his  bladder. We went into a lot of debt to pay for that surgery. We got this insurance at that time to protect us in case something else came up. A month later we were told by our vet that completely unrelated to what we were informed before with his knees Woody now has degenerate hip disease. We submitted a claim with this so called insurance company who then informed us that they are unable to cover it due to preexisting conditions. Somehow hips are closely enough related to knees that that our cat's prior incident was considered a pre-existing condition?? If you don't have this insurance already don't start it. If you do cancel it. They will find every excuse they can to not cover the care your pet needs. I would advise that the Better Business Bureau investigate the fraudulent practices and standards of this so called insurance company. Protect you and your pets by staying out and getting out of this insurance company. My estimate # was 3855133
title: Bad coverage.

text: I pay $35 /month for peace of mind. That doesn't cover well visits or shots, but it covers everything else. My 2 yr old standard poodle developed thrombocytopenia right before Christmas, requiring an emergency vet visit on Christmas Eve and multiple tests to figure out why she was so lethargic and bleeding out of every orifice. We had already met our $500 deductible, so we were reimbursed 90% of the $3000+ cost. Submitting the claims is super easy and the reimbursement is direct deposited into our checking account in about a week. None of our claims have been challenged, questioned or denied. In a world in which dealing with big companies, insurance, etc typically means waiting on hold, being scammed and not getting what you paid for, it's been refreshing to have such a straightforward and easy experience with an insurance company! If only human insurance could be the same.
title: Totally worth it

text:
Unfortunately. This company is awful and all affiliates. They charged me the "premium" rate in November of ~$120 with a 90% reimbursement. I changed to a lower rate afterwards with an 80% reimbursement. I had a claim during that month and they did not pay me out at the appropriate 90% for the amount I paid, nor did they give me the $50 back for the new and cheaper rate. I was kind enough to say they could pick which of the two options they preferred. Unfortunately by not doing either option they stole from me and will be filing BBB complaint, disputing with my bank and contacting a lawyer. 

Additionally, I am lucky that my fiance is a veterinarian and informed me that this company is indeed awful. The amount paid does not remotely reflect the appropriate coverage. There are better insurers out there, you would be wise to choose on of these options. 

Dr. Wines
title: Awful Experience

text: This is a great Pet Insurance company!! Not only do they process claims fast, their customer service are very thoughtful people and you‚Äôre not on hold for a long time when trying to reach them. I have had them for years for my previous baby which I sent many claims in and was reimbursed within 2 weeks all the time, and when my Baxter passed, they sent me a sympathy card and also called me. I just enrolled my new boy which I adopted from a shelter and I feel good about him having coverage, because you never know what can happen to a pet. Having coverage for him makes me feel at ease if anything were to happen unexpectedly, and I will get help paying the vet bill. I‚Äôm not sure about the passing date of Baxter, and really don‚Äôt want to visit the date he passed, but the month I posted is accurate.They paid for the cremation and I have his ashes in a beautiful box. I suggest for all animal lovers to get the full coverage with the 250.00 deductible, they will pay up to 4,000 for that plan and you all know how expensive vet visits are and even more for the Hospitals that want 2,000 just to check what‚Äôs wrong with a sick animal. I could never put an animal down because of the high price of emergency services which sadly many do because they don‚Äôt have 2,000 upfront to save them, so this is a great insurance to help with that. Please insure your pets! We love our babies and they love us! Keep them protected.
title: This is a great pet insurance company.

text: I've had ASPCA insurance for my sweet pup since day 1 of bringing him home (of course with the 2 week waiting period). I recommend this insurance to all the pet parents I know! I've never had any issues and anytime I've called customer service with questions or for anything, they've been incredibly helpful. I love the peace of mind that comes with having him insured since he was a puppy, but it's never too late! You want to have this before you need it, just like with any insurance! There are many tiers and options for premiums and deductibles and they are very clear what is and isn't covered. You don't have a network to stick with, and can take your pet anywhere you choose (I believe even in Canada and Mexico). I highly recommend and trust ASPCA to choose the best underwriter to put their trusted brand and name to their insurance.
title: I love the peace of mind and their coverage!

text: Great investment
title: Great investment

text: I am so grateful that I had this insurance.  My dog and I were attacked by two off-leash dogs.  My girl held her own (Great Pyrenees), however, after the owner finally got her dogs under control and leashed, my Miss Daisy walked away with a rear leg limp.  Subsequent diagnosis indicated a damaged CCL and a TPLO surgery was recommended.   Needless to say, I was devastated by this news.  I was fully aware of the cost, time, and energy involved with this procedure having worked at a vet hospital for many years.  From the beginning, ASPCA Pet Health responded promptly to my claims.  Once there was a claim date mix-up, but their customer service team corrected the error and paid the claim promptly.  I originally bought this policy because I thought my young dog would eventually eat something foreign and require a surgery.  She grew out of that phase and at one time, I considered canceling the policy. Thank goodness I did not!  After this ordeal, I will never be without pet insurance.  I tell all my friends about this company and how they saved both me and my girl.  Knowing there was financial support really helped me get through this trying time.  Thank you, thank you, thank you!
title: So Thankful!

text: We have had this Insurance on our dog now for almost 12 years. Paid the Premiums Every Month. We Never filed a Claim until he needed Dental work in April of this Year, $3400. We received 50% Reimbursement. Then this August He injured his Neck while Flinging a toy around and was in the Vet Hospital for 2 weeks, At a Cost of over $2800. Filed a Claim, 2nd claim in 11 1/2 Years and were Reimbursed $108. (This part is Edited.) 2 Weeks in the Hospital Wasn't Covered Due to the Fact the Vet Didn't Classify the 2 Week Stay as (Medically Needy)They Classified it as Boarding on their Report to the Ins. Company. Which is NOT COVERED or Correct. Make sure you understand Exactly what your plan Covers, and that the Vet understands what Their Paper work to the Insurance Company should be labeled as. Ask Questions of the Vet. Could be quite costly if you don't.. The Ins. Company only goes by what the Vet say's, Be Thorough!!
title: Is it worth it?

text:
I‚Äôm new to ASPCA pet insurance, but not pet insurance from other companies. So far, the entire entry process has been seamless. Applying for my first claim has been much easier than with previous insurance. One of the most significant selling points for me was to have pet insurance through an organization that handles pets only. Not to mention an organization that specializes in animal rescue. 
The prices are reasonable, and the options to add to your policy are excellent. Also, knowing my dog has a pre-disposition for hip dysplasia gives me a piece of mind that I won‚Äôt go into debt with veterinarian bills, even if he never develops it. 
I had a former pet that was my best friend. She got melanoma on her tongue, which, if undetected, would have killed her quickly. As you can imagine, the vet bills were astronomical, and so was the aftercare. 
When I got my new puppy, knowing he was pre-disposed to certain conditions because of the breed, I did not want to go through the financial hardship I went through with my former pup. 
The result for my previous pup was a happy long 14 years of life. She did not die from melanoma but rather from old age and kidney failure. She gave me 14 years of unconditional love, which is priceless.
title: So far, So good!

title: Pet Insurance Program

text:
When I first purchased ASPCA for my dog 2 years ago and then for my 2 cats 1 year ago I loved it. Filing claims was/is easy, you get reimbursed quickly, the company website and the layout of your online account for the plan is intuitive , everything just works. Fast forward to today and, well, I'm pissed. Before choosing ASPCA 2 years ago, I did a lot of research on the different pet insurance companies which included reading reviews and pouring over the fine print for each offered plan. I understood before purchasing a plan with ASPCA that premium rates go up each year per pet and this is true with every insurance company. What I did not anticipate is how much those increases would be and dear god its thievery. The first increase for my dogs plan ended up being +$29.11 a month. The second and most recent one? +$54.56 extra per month. Are-You-Freaking-Kidding-Me? An extra $600 a year. What about my cats you might ask? For their first increase it was about +$5 for one and +$9 for the other. This price increase is ridiculous and when you look at how much I've paid ASPCA since using them and how much I've gotten back its sickening. Now I get it, insurance is just like gambling and you always take a chance. But a price increase of almost %29 in one year? Give me a break. Pure Robbery. Needless to say, I will be canceling my plan.
Oh! What happens if you try to reach out to customer support about the increases? They tell you, "just reduce your coverage and you'll save on premiums". So basically my option is to reduce medical coverage on a family member to save money. Really? Not ok.
title: Started out awesome but yearly premium increases are insane

This was an annual, routine dental cleaning in which this insurance company DENIED my claim. I filed a claim because the teeth extractions were unexpected. It was only found out through the procedure that my dogs teeth needed to be pulled, there was no way the vet knew that beforehand because the vet even told me they wouldn‚Äôt know if or how many teeth would need to be pulled. Also- preventative care insurance basically gives you back Pennies, not reAlly worth it. text:
Month on July was not kind to my baby Kona..
dont know what I would have done , if we didnt have ASPCA Pet Insurance. 
I entered 3 claims about a couple of days apart,, See my Baby broke her front left leg.. Her Femur broke in 3 pcs.. She needed a very complicated and expensive Operation.. I have a fixed income .. ASPCA I think understand how important it is to process these claims as quickly as they can,,
within 2 days of me submitting the first 2 claims I had already received my Reimbursement , direct deposit to my bank .
the 3rd Claim was the big one, this one had the Operation and 3 night in the hospital , you all know this is not cheap either... Once again they are there for us , and process the claim within a week. and this was only because I didnt include all the information needed, once I uploaded what they needed, they processed it on a WEEKEND, yes you heard me correct, A WEEKEND.. I am grateful for ASPCA I have had them for more then 10yrs , and every time I have needed them , THEY HAVE BEEN THERE FOR ME...

text:
I do NOT recommend ASPCA Pet Insurance and encourage you to exercise caution. Their claim that "an illness is no longer pre-existing after 6 months" has numerous loopholes for denying coverage.  

My dog was 5-6 years of age at adoption, his immune system was compromised and included ear, skin, and stomach issues.  The first vet diagnosed "allergies" as the root cause of his ear and skin. This was without medical history. They proscribed months of allergy treatments (Apoquel; Cadi shots) and dehydrated dog food yet with recurring infections.  
I stopped all medications and put him on fish oil pills, probiotics, and a minimal ingredient dog food. He had no ear, skin, or stomach issues for 10 months. Following a day at the beach, his ears/skin were irritated resulting in an ear infection.    
APSCA denied benefits stating "allergies were noted 31 days prior to this policy coverage, although he went 10 months, allergies are OFTEN the root cause to an ear infection, are considered pre-existing" and will never be covered. 
There is no medical proof supporting ALL ear and skin infections are from allergies yet I was asked to prove they're not. 

This was another loophole for ASPCA to deny benefits.

I immediately canceled my policy, I find them to be dishonest and strongly suggest you look at options such as Healthy Paws.
title: I do NOT recommend ASPCA Pet Insurance‚Ä¶

text: I have been paying for over a year for both preventative care and illness for my puppy (18 months old).  I have been denied for everything: vaccines, wellness visits, neutering, microchipping, and an impacted tooth.  I was also denied for a congenital issue (a heart issue) that they said was pre-existing rather than congenital.  After paying $8000 in vet bills, and $1200 in fees to ASPCA, I have been approved for reimbursement for only $110 and it says I haven't reached my deductible of $250 yet! This definitely appears to be a scam.

text: I have had ASPCA coverage for several years on my 2 cats.  I have one cat that has had digestive issues (that I was unaware of) from the beginning.  My coverage has been excellent for her and my vet is very prompt with submitting claims.  I guess some vets don't submit as well as some are very lax in getting claims submitted.  If a claim is taking longer than you expect I would call the veterinarians office to see if the claim has been submitted in a "timely" manner by the vet staff.  This is  NOT because ASPCA is lax. I always get timely correspondence on claims being submitted and then paid.

text: I have had and still have an ASPCA pet insurance policy since 2021.  I have attempted to file several claims for my puppy French Bulldog throughout the last year, and this company has paid only 1, $20 claim to reimburse the microchipping.  Every claim was denied under the excuse of ‚Äúpre-existing condition‚Äù.  I bought the insurance 2 months after owning my dog (but before his airway issues were diagnosed).  The policy claims they will pay for congenital or breed known issues. Ha! Lie!  After my experience, I‚Äôm thinking unless you buy a policy BEFORE you own the dog, or by the 1st day you own the dog, they can claim ‚Äúpre-existing conditions‚Äù. Furthermore, I started with a premium of $45, and the same coverage increased to $65 in the course of a year.     Oh and after paying a couple thousand in medical bills, (gastrointestinal issues, and an orthopedics evaluation) none of that qualified to be applied towards the $500 deductible! Such a scam! Racket.  This company gets excellent ratings all over the internet.  It looks good on the surface, but my real life experience tells me otherwise.  I will be cancelling this policy at the renewal.
title: Don‚Äôt be deceived by their great ratings, I was‚Ä¶

text:
This company has lied to me from the start. I got insurance on both my dogs when they were puppies (11 & 12 years old now). They sold me on continuing care if they grew old and got a chronic condition. I paid over $100 to $150 a month for 10 years until my senior dog finally needed coverage. They have screwed me at every turn. They give me 3/4 (or less) of what I paid for our vet bill. Example: vet bill was $1,300 ASPCA will only pay off of $1,000 because they say in my area (which can‚Äôt be defined by the way) it ‚Äúshould‚Äù have cost that much. Then they take away the deductible and pay me the percentage based of the $1k minus the deductible. They rip you off at every turn and there is no way to fight it because, there is no defined ‚Äúarea‚Äùü§¨ BEWARE of this scam company! I have lots of documents to prove what I say. There has never been a bill that I didn‚Äôt feel like they screwed me over. The ONLY reason I have them is my dog is now a senior and cost is crazy to get them on another insurance. I have so many more examples of how they did me dirty with the continuing care I‚Äôve been paying on since the beginning to only find out it is only good for a year! Yep a year! Then it is considered a pre existing condition. 

I despise this company. Will never use them again for anything, nor will I donate to their cause. There are plenty more animal groups who I will gladly give my money to help animals in need.
title: BEWARE Best scam for pet insurance

text: ASPCA Pet Insurance had been nothing but incredible for Picasso. I've left his annual deductible at 250, annual coverage at 7-10k each year since he was 3 and have reached it twice. Their claims process has been so easy. I'm able to upload my invoices by pictures to their online portal and the longest part is waiting for my vet to send records. Claims during COVID took longer because like everywhere else they had short staffing but they were transparent with estimates on claim completion. ASPCA has covered his TPLO, arthritis, IBD, prescription food, longterm medications, CT, and now chemotherapy. My only mistake was decreasing his coverage thinking I could make it a year at a lower rate but naturally that's when cancer hit. Their customer service has been incredible, employees have been realistic and pleasant, and reimbursement has been quick ( 1 week to 1month during covid). Their premiums aren't the cheapest I've seen but their coverage was the most comprehensive when I signed up. Rates do continue to go up, but so does everything in life. I've thankfully never used it for my cat but I have no doubt they would be just as amazing with her as they have been with Picasso. I recommend them every chance I get!
title: Incredible and trustworthy

text:
At first I wasn't sure if I really needed pet insurance, but to be honest it was the best decision. My Bernie Pena (Saint Bernard) was born on March 28th, 2015 and we had him for 7 amazing years. Unfortunately, there was issues with his spinal cord. I saw a lot of people put down their dogs because it was too expensive to simply diagnose their dogs. When we were put into an uncomfortable position to take our Saint to the hospital, we did it without hesitation because we knew that our insurance covered 90% of the bill with a $500.00 deductible. We did everything we could knowing that money (because of our insurance) was not an issue. I told myself that I would hate to be put in a position of putting my dog to sleep because of money. When my Saint passed away ASPCA called to give me their condolences. To everyone that I once talked to at ASPCA for a claim/ insurance questions, Thank you! 

During hard times you made life easier!
title: At first I wasn't sure if I really‚Ä¶

text:
Watch out for terms that are not disclosed in their marketing:  Claims limited to percentage of "Usual and Customary". Reimbursements are not adjusted for costs in different cities, and are inadequate for high-cost areas. Little to no information is provided in advance about typical reimbursement rates, rather you need to presubmit a bill for advice, after you have the plan. Cumbersome and unrealistic. They should at least provide sample reimbursement scenarios for various standardized situations, as is done with human healthcare.

Also, claims denied after 270 days after service, even during Covid emergency.

Too expensive for what you get. Used to be a good policy, not any more. The plus side is that the salesmen, and perhaps the claims agents, are happy to spend a lot of time on the phone with you, if you like that sort of thing. I would prefer those resources be used to increase reimbursements, not just talk.
title: Watch out for terms that are not disclosed

text: Signed my puppy up for pet insurance.  There is a 14-day waiting period (some other pet insurance plans do not have it).  Got a call from ASPCA Insurance to verify some things and told the customer service rep that our puppy was staying elsewhere for a couple of days, but he is ours and paid for.  She said that the 14-day waiting period could only start from the day the puppy was brought to our house.  I asked her where this is stated in the contract, she could not point me to that clause.  She then offered to extend the 14 day waiting period to 14 days from the time the puppy comes to our house.  To make a long story short, I canceled the contract and signed our puppy up with a different insurance company (which does not have a waiting period at all) - if this is how it starts, not sure how many more ‚Äúexceptions‚Äù there would be.

text:
My dog had an awful accident and had to have emergency surgery. I paid for it, knowing I had pet insurance, but after hearing so many horror stories, I was worried my claim would be denied. 

I submitted my claim on a Monday, it was marked as completed on Wednesday, and the money was deposited directly into my bank account by the next Monday. So it took just one week to process my claim and get reimbursed. 

I did have to call customer support about a question I had on my claim form, and they were incredibly kind and helpful, and asked about how my pet was recovering. I was pleasantly surprised and really happy with my experience.

text: Probably one of the worst insurance companies for a pet you could have. They use any sickness claim you submit and blame it on ‚Äúallergies‚Äù or a ‚Äúpre existing condition.‚Äù You pay monthly for no claim to be reimbursed, or applied towards your deductible. There are way better insurance companies that will treat their clients right!
title: horrible! Don‚Äôt waste your time!

text: Unethical and terrible customer service. I got my Cane Corso, Waylon, in early July of 2020, took him to his first vet appointment in late July, and purchased insurance within a couple weeks of that. So within the first month of having him he went to the vet and insurance policy had been purchased. When I took him to his initial veterinarian appointment to get established the vet gave me the run down on what to expect with this breed health wise as he was my first of this breed. In her briefing she mentioned to me something called entropion and warned it was common in this breed (along with stomach flipping and hip issues) so don't be surprised if he ends up with it even if it is mild. Over a year later in September 2021 he had surgery for entropion because he started showing signs of it, it was causing eye infections, and later was diagnosed with entropion. The surgery, medications, and recovery are a very costly process for a dog of this size. I filed the claim directly after his surgery and it was denied. I attempted to appeal and it was denied. The reason given was that his diagnosis was a preexisting condition according to the insurance due to vet records. False. Vet records mentioned that i was given a run down that entropion could be a possibility given how common it is with the breed, it was NOT a diagnosis of the condition. So they denied me, gave very short responses, and essentially was not allowed to appeal because they stated that the vet records were proof that it was preexisting. So, in a nut shell GO ELSEWHERE for your pet insurance and keep track of what your vet includes in their notes for your pet because it does matter what is mentioned to unethical insurance companies looking to get out of paying what they are supposed to.
title: Unethical, Possible Scam, Terrible Customer Service

text: Our baby can walk because we had ASPCA pet insurance. We came home one night and found her laying on the floor unable to move her back legs, she was paralyzed. The emergency hospital bill alone was $1,500. The surgeon was another $7,500. We had $100 deductible and 90% reimbursement. Because we had the insurance we were able to have her treated without worrying about whether we could afford it. I called and they pre authorized the procedure which sped up the processing time and we had payment within a week. It's now been two years and gets around just as well as she always had. text: ASPCA Pet insurance is amazing!  I did not get it until my kitty Tsunami was 17 years old as she had been healthy her whole life.  I knew she was getting older and I wanted her to have a fighting chance if anything went wrong.  After having the insurance for about 8 months, Tsunami all of sudden became ill.  I really wasn't sure what the insurance covered but I did what I needed to do to find out what was wrong with my baby.  After several vet trips with tests and bloodwork and finally a biopsy my baby was diagnosed with Oral cancer.  She lasted about a week after the final diagnosis and we said our goodbyes at home when Paws into GRACE came to us.  The grief and the sadness we felt was overwhelming but I have to give this insurance company some major credit as I was able to get back more than half of what I had paid for Tsunami's end of life care and all the expenses to diagnose and treat.  It took a huge financial burden off of us which is the last thing you need when you are grieving a loss!  Thank you ASPCA Pet Health Insurance for being there for us during this difficult time.  They even called us today to give us condolences for our loss.  I highly recommend this company due to the amazing customer service that I experienced.
title: ASPCA Pet insurance is amazing
