text:
I rarely write reviews but feel this is necessary since the cost of pet care has increased over the years and the accessibility to vet services has shrunk (primarily due to COVID-19 and the staffing/workplace issues it has caused). 

I researched pet insurances for my cat, 7 y.o./m/domestic, for a good year. He had no health problems (other than being two pounds overweight). But since he was turning 7, I figured it was a good time to get pet insurance and be more pro-active about preventative care. I was delighted when I found ASPCA because it's a nonprofit entity. Now, I know that ASPCA just licenses its name to the underwriting firm, but I would expect that such an institution would make sure that their name is used in good faith. Nothing could be further from the truth. 

ASPCA insurance is underwritten by Crump and Forster, a firm that also underwriters and administers pet insurance plans for several other pet insurance companies. 

I brought my cat to the vet 6 weeks after the "waiting period" on the insurance plan (two weeks from the effective date on the policy, which was March 11th). Anything that happens during the waiting period is considered "pre-existing condition." There were no issues with my cat. The only existing record occurred in May of 2021 that showed, aside from being slightly overweight, my cat was in perfect health. 

During the vet visit, it was decided my pet needed to see an  ophthalmologist to assist in diagnosing and treating what is thought to be conjunctivitis. This was an assessment made by the specialist who also conveyed that it may NOT be purely conjunctivitis, and a three week course of medicine would be required to assess. 

I left the vet's office with the medicine and follow up appointment. The total cost of the visit was $400 (not counting the medicine). 

Per the plan with the ASPCA, I have a $500 deductible. After submitting my claim with the ASPCA, and after affirmation from my vet's office that my cat was examined and treated for conjunctivitis, I saw that $0 of the $400 I spent during the visit would count towards my deductible. 

The ASPCA insurance reasoning was two codes w/out any explanation. 

Code 2 (Pre-existing condition) and Code 25 (not-covered). 

Per my policy, I met the conditions for having my cat's visit at least by somewhat contributory towards my annual deductible. When attempting to contact a representative, I was simply told what Code 2 and Code 25 mean. 

That is, no other explanation as to why was offered despite my dismay. Even someone at the veterinary office agreed that it was odd (to put it in kind terminology) that (a) conjunctivitis would be considered a pre-existing condition and (b) the insurance company would offer a code of "not covered" under the plan. 

After promptly cancelling my plan with ASPCA Pet Insurance, I re-read the policy twice more and came to the conclusion that the underwriters have written the policy in such a way that they can exclude anything at their discretion and give absolutely zero reasoning as to why. 

Upon cancelling, there was no final effort or communication to communicate to me why such denial codes were given, let alone an explanation for such. 

ASPCA Pet Insurance demonstrates why many pet owners think pet insurance is a scam. I followed the rules, did what was right for my cat, and was stonewalled. 

Obviously, I understand the ASPCA is different from the insurance company they contract with to offer pet insurance. But just be forewarned that you aren't actually dealing with the ASPCA. You're dealing with Crum and Forster (insurance plan admins) and the underwriting firm the company owns, United States Fire Insurance Company.

I reiterate that ASPCA simply licenses their branding and identity to the firm and has no interest, oversight, or interaction with "their" pet insurance.

I'm disappointed but not surprised at the outcomes associated with my brief time as an "ASPCA Pet Insurance" policy holder. Going forward, I will simply put some cash away each month and/or look into a product like Care Credit.
title: Vague Policies, Poor Communication, Bad Outcomes

text:
I have filed mutliple claims, never get anyone to call you back and I am the one as the consumer either calling my vet and aspca and all they tell you is "we still require more info". So fast forward to today and i spoke with James(a supervisor). Who so told me i don't qualify for any reimbursement despite meeting the $500 deductible as he claimed to have reviewed my claims and nothing I had was detailed until he started to read them whilst on the phone with me. He then goes to tell me that my pet's condition was pre-existing before starting with aspca. Which is not true, as at the time starting with aspca last year my dog had a hot spot which the vet said could be from shampoo, licking or lying on the area, James continued to tell me that all of my claims were allergy based. I explained to him as he agreed that my claims did mention everything I was telling him. My dog got diagnosed eventually with arthritis, James persisted on telling me this goes back to the "hot spot allergy". My vet did blood work to rule out everything elae and diagnosed it as being cancer. James said that he understands but that is related to allergies and aspca will not cover it. I said his hair loss he also had (which was symmetrical and all over his body coming out in clumps and veterinarian stated that it was endocrine related) and james said that too is allergy related. I asked if he was even listening to what i was saying? He literally never acknowledged me and said there is nothing they can do. But i can appeal but he said they will turn it down based on what i told him. This company is a scam, unethical, they make nothing intuitive or easy todo. And no one ever reaches back to the consumer. Someone has to be held responsible. I demand i get my money back as I clearly had no coverage or support, i should be compensated for doing their job of contacting each party.
I believe I am eligible to receive the money that I paid for this insurance per above.
If I do not get a reimbursement I will take the next actions to assure less people fall victim to this. As no one has been helpful, my dog is absolutely sick, we have a new born baby, and my research indicated that having pet insurance would make our lives less stressful. It made it more stressful, like I said previously, I always had to call you guys and my vet. James(the supervisor), told me my claim descriptions were not detailed enough until he reviewed them on the phone with me live. This leads me to the conclusion that ASPCA does not follow up with the Vet and Doctors to get the official diagnosis/diagnoses as it didn‚Äôt matter that I noted this on my claims. And wouldn‚Äôt you think at some point, customer service would have said ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt reimburse for blah blah blah, so you don‚Äôt need to waste your time filing a claim, calling us and calling your vet‚Äù??

text: I spent the better part of a Sunday afternoon researching multiple pet insurance policy‚Äôs. There were pros and cons to each of them, as there would be with anything involving insurance. However, for me the pros for the ASPCA‚Äô monthly premiums, deductible, reimbursement options, and finally the waiting period until the plan is effective outweighed the cons. I liked that you can tailor your plan to your pets specific needs. All the while making sure that you have enough coverage, and the deductible you‚Äôre comfortable having to come out of pocket for annually. The one downside, or inconvenience is that the claims aren‚Äôt handled by the veterinarians office. Each qualifying visit requires you to gather all the information for the form to be completed, and then send it to the claims center for review to get reimbursed. Other than the additional steps you as the owners have to take for the claims process, it seems to be a pretty solid choice.

text:
Reading the reviews of this pet insurance lead me to believe it would be a fair and safe bet if my 11 year old dog were to develop an illness in her elder years. Unfortunately after paying into this plan for several months, they offered no financial support and took months to even respond to our claims.
Our dog became ill very shortly after the insurance went into effect, though there had been no signs and therefore no medical record of a pre-existing condition when we signed up for the insurance. If there had been, I wouldn‚Äôt have filed a claim for the illness. Although the condition- a terminal brain tumor- required an MRI for which was purportedly covered under the plan, upon filing a claim as we struggled with how to afford these suddenly overwhelming bills, we waited over 3 months for the claim to be denied. The ASPCA claimed flimsily that the condition had been pre-existing based on medical records describing lethargy and joint pain. These were attributed to old age by our vet, not neurological issues.
The ASPCA called and sent emails of condolence upon her passing, but this was empty comfort coming from a company that took my money without holding up their end of the bargain. I feel jaded by this experience. If you have a very healthy young dog and are willing to pay into a plan for years before being able to use it, it may be for you. But you may want to weigh the expense of paying into a costly pet insurance for years against the cost of the actual bills in the end, and also with the added risk that they will use any evidence in your pet‚Äôs medical record to deny your rightful claim. 
 I feel I threw away hundreds of dollars and hours of my time. The veneer of this insurance seems great, but sadly it seems they will do whatever it takes, even if dishonest, to deny deserved financial compensation.
title: Will deny valid claims, waste of money

In the end, the high limits and high denials did not make the policies (for 2 dogs) worthwhile.  I am not renewing for the second year.

Also, I support the ASCPA & Humane Society so just another way to do that.
title: After searching through the top ten pet‚Ä¶

text: I reviewed a lot of insurance policies. The ASPCA policy was the most flexible with what we wanted for our pup, Dexter. My vet believed in their ability to service our needs and gave me two of her personal recommendations.  It says a lot when my pups health care provider would trust them to insure her pets!  I liked the flexible, budget friendly cost for services. I also love the fact that my pup can go to any vet, in any state!! We are planning on traveling more with him in the future but the peace of mind that his coverage is coast to coast is extremely appealing.  We also decided to pick up the dental insurance for him.  The cost is approximately .25 cents per day.  I‚Äôm hoping he does not have any trouble when his baby teeth come. If he does, we‚Äôre covered.  I would highly recommend that you do your research then check out the ASPCA! I don‚Äôt think that you will be disappointed.
title: What more could you ask for?

text:
I am so very glad that I signed up for ASPCA pet insurance for both of my cats. I appreciate the different deductible amounts you can choose from. I also applaud the ASPCA for not excluding pets when they become a certain age. ASPCA believes the care our pets need are the pet parents and the veterinarians decisions.

 Our cat Squishy became very ill recently and we have had many vet appointments. After our $500 deductible had been met, the insurance is paying 80% of her visits. This is helping out so much because I have had three pets that have been very ill and had no insurance. We had to pay thousands of dollars for care. She is very ill and I want to give her the best care.

The claim forms are very easy to send, email, fax, or you can use their app. The claims were taking about three to four weeks to be processed, but the claims are being paid much quicker now.

The wait times can be long on the phone, but I always leave my phone number. A representative always calls me back the same day and is very pleasant.

Thank you ASPCA for helping our family give the best care for our amimals.
title: ASPCA Pet Insurance

text: I initially researched the coverage online and decided what I wanted, then called to see if I could set it up to start at a later date than what I was offered online. Everybody on the phones were super nice, confirmed we could pick a date to start coverage, but I was immediately shuffled away from the product I wanted over to something that I was told is identical. If it's identical, including price, why can't I have what I wanted? It just weirded me out and seemed like a sketchy sale tactic, especially when accompanied by telling me about their own (supposed) pet and all the costly things that had come up, and didn't I want to triple my coverage? I ended up just waiting and making the purchase online by myself. Will avoid calling in the future, if able.
title: Manipulative sales tactic, nice website, too soon to review the coverage itself.

text: Extremely disappointed. I cannot reach anyone on the phone for months to the point where I just give up. I understand that there are limits to what the insurance covers, but this company actually considers any conditions my pet has had in the past year a pre-existing condition, mind you, I have had this policy active for almost two years now. What a way to weasel out of actually helping pet owners cover the costs. Two months ago I submitted two claims where I paid more than $1,000 for my dog's vet visits (part of that was an allergy test to find out that my dog is chronically allergic to almost everything!) and I got a pitiful $34 reimbursed, on top of the $93 every month (22 months now) I am paying into the insurance. I feel like I would have actually saved money by not having this so-called "Insurance" after all. Even worse is that this provider is not even run by the ASPCA themselves (an actually good organization), but by Crum and Forster Insurance Group which only purchased the rights to use the name of ASPCA. Long wait times for claims, pitiful reimbursements, considering anything from last year's coverage period now a pre-existing condition, and on top of that, I can't even talk to somebody over the phone due to "higher call volumes" or whatever excuse they have. I would expect that with all the money I (and other pet owners) am paying that they could at least hire more staff to handle the call volumes, but apparently they don't hire anybody at all. What is the point of having insurance if it won't actually help you when you need it? I still am expected to pay the full price upfront for any and all medical needs for my pet, including accidental injuries or illnesses. What option is there for somebody who cannot afford the upfront costs for an unexpected emergency with their pet? Just let them suffer or die? Awful company, awful communication, awful excuse for "insurance", awful coverage, and overall waste of money that feels more like a scam than peace of mind.
title: Extremely disappointed. Not worth it. Just a scam! Better off to save your money.

text:
We‚Äôve had a policy on our cat, Piggy Grace, since October 2018. Every year, our monthly premium has increased by a few dollars, with no explanation for the increase. 

This year, when her policy renews in October, our monthly premium will increase by $10!  This moves us from $33 a month to $43 dollars a month. Again, no explanation given for the increase. 

Piggy Grace was diagnosed with chronic kidney disease in December 2019. Therefore, we are unable to look for more affordable coverage because all other insurance companies classify the CKD as a pre-existing condition and won‚Äôt cover her medical treatments. 

This leaves us with two options:  reduce Piggy‚Äôs annual limit and/or reduce her reimbursement percentage, or cancel our policy. Neither option is in her best interest.  

Raising monthly premiums this drastically puts many pet guardians of a sick animal in a difficult position and forces them to make hard decisions.  A diagnosis of CKD is heartbreaking on many levels.  The only consolation we had was knowing that we could provide the absolute best care for Piggy because of her insurance.

09/15/2021 update in response to the reply from ASPCA Pet Health Insurance on this review:  

I emailed your customer service to discuss this issue (no one ever replied to the email or called me).  I called customer service today:  first, let me say that the representative was very kind and as helpful as she could be in this situation.  However, she gave me the same answer that you gave on this review.  She could only offer the advice of reducing our annual coverage or increasing our deductible to keep our monthly premium at a lower rate.  

Once again, no one has been able to explain to me why our monthly premium is increasing by $10!  So frustrating.
title: Monthly Premiums Increase Every Year

text: I called customer service to add the preventive pet care that is free and I waited literally for 20 minutes on the line on hold hoping I could speak to a customer service representative. The machine tells you if you want to be called back, and they will hold your spot on line. I couldn't wait on hold anymore so I did that option. They did not call me back, in fact I am still waiting on hold. Due to this, I am cancelling this service and will go with another company for my pet insurance. This is ridiculous! I could only imagine how my family would be treated if one of my kittens got hurt, and by the way I have two female precious kittens who we love to death, which is why we purchased medical insurance in the first place. Good luck to everyone else who has had a positive experience, however for us, this is our first time purchasing pet insurance, and our first time owning cats. We are dog people. Our beloved Richie, my siberian husky died of cancer. We didn't have pet insurance and could not afford chemotherapy for him. They wanted 10.000 dollars for it. Absolutely not, Richie was 12 1/2 yrs old, a senior dog who we had since he was four months old. Quite frankly, pet insurance did not exist when we got him in 2007, now we go to purchase pet insurance and we get no call backs or responses? I am sorry, but I will not take chances with my babies.

text:
Unfortunately, my horse has had a lot of medical issues this year. She's a rescue so I've just been trying to get her to a healthy baseline. Seeing that ASPCA cares about animal welfare, I thought they would be a good option. I got comprehensive coverage. I submit claims every time she needs care, and they almost never count towards my deductible or reimbursement. They always find a reason to decline coverage. It makes me think they don't care about animals afterall. The routine care supplemental policy is not worth it. Their annual limits are nowhere near what the care actually costs, so you get a fraction back. They take weeks to process you claims, and if their verdict is incorrect, expect to wait another few weeks to even hear back. Their wait times on the phone are exceptionally long 40+ minutes on hold just to talk to someone. They take weeks to reply to emails. I have been waiting weeks for an estimate for surgery before scheduling it and still have not received an answer. 
In response to your reply: I did give you a call at that number yesterday and was on hold for 2.5 hours. Once your office closed, you hung up the line, so I was not able to speak with anyone. I cannot commit to being on hold all day. I have sent emails so please feel free to help me there.
title: Poor Service

text: I got pet insurance for my two new kittens after spending 3k on my cat before he died. I figured even just paying the premium would still be cheaper than what we spent on medical bills already and at least we‚Äôd have peace of mind. Several months after purchasing the complete coverage plan, one cat started having GI issues which ended up requiring RX food, bloodwork, countless checkups and services. ASPCA has made good on all of it. His premium has paid for itself. When I called customer service to ask questions about continuing care when his new policy cycle begins, the call center rep was very kind, patient, honest and informative. Biggest pro is that, unlike other places, conditions can‚Äôt be considered pre-existing from a previous policy cycle. TLDR: one cat‚Äôs payouts have paid for the premium and then some- my other cat is the pinnacle of health and the payouts haven‚Äôt added up, but if he ever has an accident or something like that, I‚Äôll know we‚Äôre covered. The preventative care option isn‚Äôt the best- I‚Äôm dropping it next year. Overall, very pleased. The only sucky thing is the time it takes to process claims. I‚Äôve been with them for a year now and 90% of my claims have taken a month or more to be resolved.
title: Yay continuing coverage!

text: We shopped around for pet insurance and narrowed our search to about 6 companies and plans. In comparing all side by side, the ASPCA plan had the most benefits for the best price and also didn't feel like we we're paying for things that we really didn't need. text: I am very happy with choosing ASPCA Pet Health Insurance for Heidi. She was acutely ill & needed to be taken to a Pet ER. My husband was shocked with the charge. I submitted the claim to ASPCA. After taking out the deductible, 80% of the claim was reimbursed to me. Heidi had to follow up with her vet since she had lingering symptoms. I submitted that claim that reimbursed at 80% to me. The speed that the claims paid were unbelievable. I was reimbursed within 2 weeks. Submission of the claim is simple. One takes a picture of it on their phone & submits it. A brief explanation of the illness is enclosed on the online form. I am very satisfied with the ASPCA Pet Health Insurance.

text:
DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY. 
I got this insurance for my horse, and it's easily one of the biggest scams I've ever seen. My horse got a suspensory ligament strain as a result of an injury and they're refusing to cover a penny of my horse's diagnostic tests and any treatment. I've spoken with multiple reps who assured me that this injury and treatment would be covered; however, I was arbitrarily told it now won't be as they're considering this injury an "illness." I will promptly be telling every horse-owning soul I come into contact with to avoid this insurance like the plague.

**EDIT** clearly they‚Äôve responded with the generic: reach out if you‚Äôd like to talk more. I don‚Äôt appreciate this as I‚Äôve spoken with multiple reps to great lengths about issues with this company and when I asked to speak to a higher up, I was told the person I was speaking to was the highest up person I could talk to. ASPCA Per Insurance does not care about their customers not their pets.
title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY

Horrible pet insurance (if you want to call it that) I got my puppy in August of 2008, and insured him right away. Never ONCE missed a payment nor had a lapse in coverage. I had it all or so I thought. Accident, wellness and sickness with a 100.00 dollars deductible. Never filed a claim for yrs but when he got a bad mouth infection and needed teeth pulled they didn't pay a cent for his surgery, Over 2000.00 dollars and not ONE cent did they pay as it was pre-existing because I knew the previous year he needed work done. He ended up with Congestive heart failure in later years and they paid NOT ONE CENT as it was a preexisting condition too as he had a heart murmur! 

I put him down this past Wednesday as he developed kidney failure and I didn't want him to suffer. It about killed my wife and I to put down our boy. They informed me two weeks before that they would NEVER pay anything that had to do with his CHF or any problems arising through such. I cannot tell you how sickend I am with this company and the people that work there. NO heart whatsoever! They don't give one iota about your pet, only money which I payed to them dearly over the course of 12 years. I paid them well over 15 thousand in that time period and they reimbursed me probably 1000.00! That is it!!! I was paying $271.00 each month in the end. Tell me, why are these people even in this business? Money, that's it! Don't make the same mistake as my wife and I did. Find another insurance for your beloved family members!
title: Horrible pet insurance (if you want to‚Ä¶

text: I've had so many pets in my lifetime, but never opted for pet insurance. Last year, after a few years without a pet, we got a pure-breed and I decided to get him insurance "just in case...". I looked into various companies, and asked our veterinarian for recommendations - they lead me to ASPCA. I signed our boy up assuming we'd rarely, if ever, need it; but my goodness I am so glad we did, and all the more glad we went with ASPCA. Although the processing time has been slow, yes, they have accurately honored all the claims I have submitted which has provided great relief. I had called customer service regarding my first claim, and the gentleman that took my call was SO nice and helpful - I truly appreciated his demeanor and the insight he was able to share at that time. These are unprecedented times all around, and the crisis that our little guy has endured has been harrowing; but through proper care for him coupled with efficient insurance through ASPCA, we're able to breath a bit and say "thank you."
title: Grateful for ASPCA

text: I have been an ASPCA customer for about six months now.  While I cannot point to any specifically fraudulent or grossly negligent conduct, this is not a company I would recommend to anyone.  Be aware that ASCPA is underwritten by another company, Crum & Forster, which causes information gaps and discrepancies in how claims are processed.  In addition, CF construes their coverage and policy VERY narrowly, and, at least in our case, has already denied multiple claims that, under a plan reading of the policy, should be covered.  Finally, their backlog of claims processing, refusal to follow through or communicate regarding vet correspondence, and exceptionally long wait and response times for customer service reps is unacceptable.

text: Read the latest reviews and I have to say, I am surprised how people are not happy with ASPCA. Personally I have a very good experience. Yes, the claims are taking longer lately, but it's understandable since pet ownership is on the rise, work force is reduced and claim numbers have been increased. I have had them for about 6 years, and they always processed claims effectively, and barely ever needed additional information from the vet. I always try to make sure that I request detailed bill before I submit the claim, so I minimize the chances of them needing something from the vet. Recently my baby girl (9yr old boxer) has been diagnosed with lymphoma and she has been going to the oncology specialist and has received couple chemo treatments. Bills are huge. Yes, they did take longer than usual (I rec'd an email from them telling me that they are having high volume of claims and they were apologizing for the delay) but they processed them and paid almost full 90% as promised. The only reason I can afford this expensive chemo therapy is due to me counting on them to reimburse me so I can pay the bill. So overall, I wish I had this kind of insurance myself. Way more efficient and affordable than hoomans insurance.
title: Read the latest reviews and I have to‚Ä¶

text: The absolute worst insurance experience of anything I‚Äôve ever had insurance on! Car, home, life, phone, flood!! title: My dog has been going through a lot...

text:
When Olly had a giant GI issue in October of 2019, I started looking into Accident and Illness pup insurance. He already had a wellness package with his veterinarian, but like many of you have already found out - these generally only include wellness visits, dentals, and vaccines.

This wasn't going to cut it. I spent weeks researching pet insurance. Best reviewed companies, emails to representatives, trial basses, pre-existing conditions checks. The top ranked companies all failed my most basic expectations. 

Dental tartar - a pre-existing condition. A hot spot from a cone that rubbed his neck raw, a pre-existing condition. Things that not even a human insurance would consider "pre-existing" - all pre-existing. 

This appalled me. I would think a pet insurance company would truly care for the animals they care for. Not one of them did.

I started looking at customer reviews for these companies. They were horrendous, the people agreed.

I finally stumbled across the ASPCA's, underwritten by a Fire Insurance company. I was amazed. This companies customer reviews blew all others out of the water. Their stipulations were fair and compassionate at the same time. Pre-existing conditions were not a ghost to forever haunt your medical history. 

I signed up and I moved on with my life and forgot about it. Until Olly developed GDV during the COVID 19 shutdown. Three veterinary visits in one day. Followed by a trip to the Animal Emergency Clinic that night and emergency surgery. 

I had more vet visits in 1 month than I ever had in a year (and let's face it, I love him, but my dog is a lemon) - and I remembered the insurance I purchased. 

I downloaded the app, took a few pictures of paperwork and submitted his first claim. Simple as that. The wait time for processing wasn't horrible. I received my reimbursement. It had truly been a blessing. Where I would have had no other choices, I was able to save Olly when I otherwise wouldn't have been able to afford it.

If I could ask for one thing, it would be the ability for bills to be handled like humans at a doctors office. Unfortunately, everything is paid by you in advance to the hospitals and clinic. This is a requirement of the hospitals and clinics themselves.

You submit your claim for reimbursement. While this is not ideal, its the best option available.
title: A pet insurance company that actually cares

text: I‚Äôve had this insurance for a few years now. In that time my cat has had a number of issues with ear hematomas. He needed two surgeries, many appointments, medications, check ups etc. Our aspca insurance has been very reliable, fast, great communication and friendly customer service people to help with the process. There haven‚Äôt been any hidden fees or them trying to find a way out of paying. It‚Äôs made some very stressful situations so much better. It‚Äôs a peace of mind I would never even consider not having. My little family is grateful!
title: Peace of mind during difficult times.

text: As a veterinary professional, I know how valuable pet insurance is and opt to cover both of my cats for peace of mind should they ever need emergency surgery or oncology treatment. Coverage is great as most things are included, but one of my cat's premiums went up 37% this year. When I called to inquire to the steep increase, I was told that it was a combination of an across the board increase for all cats and and increase for her age, as she just turned 5yr. Of course, I can't sustain that kind of increase every year so I asked what I could expect going forward. I was given the yearly percentage increase I can expect every year for the rest of her life (except age 6) - which is anywhere from 4.7-20% each year. Only two increases between now and age 16 would be less than 10%, most are 10-17%. I understand costs increase with age but these increases are much to steep and I can't realistically afford them long term. I'd try to switch insurance companies but she now has one pre-existing condition that won't be covered by anybody else now - so I feel trapped with ASPCA if I want her to have coverage. I don't know how I'm going to find the money for these annual increases, even just in the next 5 years - but it's either that or she gets no coverage. I used to recommend ASPCA insurance to clients at my veterinary hospital, but this has made me pause to recommend it without sharing the good and the bad.
title: Comprehensive coverage but unsustainable annual premium increases

text:
I wouldn't say they are horrible because they have helped me through a lot of issues with my dog. The area I do not agree with is their "opinion" of pre-existing conditions. A dog that itches doesnt mean it is related to allergies. Could be mites, atopic dermatitis, a crawling insect, and so much more! When I adopted my dog he has some itchy skin. The vet did skin scrape and nothing abnormal was seen however we treated as if it was demodex and after a little while the itching resolved. Over a year later my dog developed itching so since I am in the veterinary field I chose to take him to a dermatologist. ASPCA said the "itching" was pre-existing. He was itching for a completely different reason. I appealed and the still determined it was pre-existing. Not much I can do but keep them because my dog will need another hip surgery soon and I cant go to another company because that really is pre-existing.

text:
First policy was in Oregon for six years where all went well but for a couple of minor things that had to be discussed and settled. (with acceptable outcomes)!

My Baby boy (Butters) came down with CHF. Something I Never, NEVER thought would happen to my best buddy, but it did. They have been very good about paying my claims and there have been quite a few, as well as regular medicines that are covered and not cheap. So maybe for a few years they made a little money off me but the last few years they have been paying claims and lucky if they make a dime. I highly recommend calling them to ask a boatload of questions and clarify anything that is not 100% obvious to you in the contract/description before buying. It will save some headaches down the road for everyone. I did this and was surprised by the level of service and competence that I had received. After I had spoken to three companies that week, it was a no brainer to settle with these guys/gals. They were able to answer all my questions and really made a good impression. After some time I can see that I happened to pick the right one!  Only the best for my baby!

text:
I had to get a supervisor involved to stop the cycle of Deny and Delay which is a technique Insurance companies use to not pay their portion.
I wonder what would happen if I didn't have the Education in the Insurance business to call them on their game and make them pay what they should.
I would not recommend this or 2 of the other (Pet Plan and Healthy Paws) Pet Insurances I have tried.  Pet Plan was very dishonest.  They didn't tell me until they pulled money off my credit card, that the dog had to have a new exam within 2 weeks though he just had his annual exam. By that time I was on the way to California and the dog was in Florida with my brother.  I called them they not only refused to cancel it as it wasn't even in effect for two weeks, they pulled an extra month.  Discover Card rectified the situation.   The game is always the same Deny and Delay hoping the less educated and persistent consumer will give up.
The ASPCA supervisor is wonderful.  The people that answer the phone are very pleasant.  It is the ASPCA Claims department that is not to be trusted.

title: Review

text:
I‚Äôm writing to all future and existing customers to make them aware of the way this company runs. Be aware that if your pet gets sick, the insurance company can easily deny coverage based on lab work performed previously. There are many customer with the same complaint or even worse, just read the reviews with 1 or 2 stars.

They will simply deny any coverage if your pet had elevated numbers in previous lab work and label it as preexisting condition. 

All this time I thought this company would be a peace of mind to us when you need them the most. But I was wrong and they just took all the money I‚Äôve paid for about 3 years.

I never used their benefits because my cat has been healthy for about 14 years. Now my cat has been unwell, she lacks of appetite and has weigh loss.

I took her to the vet, they did a completely lab work and the doctor said that her kidneys are failing. The doctor suggested three days of IV fluids in the hospital to help her with the toxins in the blood.

I called ASPCA to have an authorization to proceed with the IV therapy, and they simply said that they won‚Äôt cover it because this is related to a lab work she had 2 years ago.
 
Now, not even the future care is not going to be cover but the also the tests and visit performed yesterday.

My cat was never diagnosed with any disease before now, but the insurance support their denial based on the lab work she had two years ago.

They just let me paid the premiums all this time but never notified me or letting me know that due to those test results my cat was never going to be cover.

Now after paying more than $600 in premiums for the ‚ÄúIllnesses and Accident‚Äù coverage and another $500 for yesterday‚Äôs visit, they keep telling me that the latest test and vet visit won‚Äôt be covered because it is related to the tests two years ago.

Now if my cat passes away, the euthanasia and the cremation won‚Äôt be covers because according to the insurance the visit and lab work is related to the tests performed 2 years ago and those charges won‚Äôt satisfy the deductible.

I‚Äôve talked to them several times and they simply don‚Äôt care. 

I wish I knew about they way they do business.

This is simply not fair to my family and any one with a beloved pet.
title: Not a company with moral and ethical principles.

text: Honestly, I love them so much. I don‚Äôt know what I would do without ASPCE insurance. I had two furry ones pass away the past two years and knowing that I‚Äôm doing everything I can for my last fur baby makes me so happy. I think their prices are so reasonable and their customer service is on point. I would say the only reason why I don‚Äôt give a full 5 star review its because claims do take a bit to process. 2-4 weeks and most of the time they need medical records from your vet which makes the process take longer. However, I haven‚Äôt had any problems with claims. Everything I have submitted has been approved and reimbursed without much trouble.
title: Honestly, I don‚Äôt know what I would do without them!

text: Writing a review for a product is a straightforward endeavor, rate the merchandise,pass along the pros and cons. But in this case I am not rating a product, I am rating more than that. When faced with a crisis with your pet that will cost thousands of dollars, you hope that your insurance will pay. You assume...that's what you pay the monthly premium for. Yet while sitting next to another pet parent who was panicked because her insurance did not cover her dogs emergency surgery i became panicked and phoned a rep. First thing, the rep could read the anxiety and crackling in my voice and reassured me and calmed me down. She asked what was going on and explained SHE could not guarantee benefits over the phone but would work with the surgical staff to immediately get an estimate to their dept that would approve the procedure or not. Within an hour the procedure was approved.  The kindness and concern for my well being and my pets was greater than my friends or our family other than our immediate  family. It should be noted that this is the second time in three months we had to call on our insurance, met with the same care and respect.  Regarding ease of submission,  you literally load an app and take a picture of your bill and submit it. That easy. For the initial registration I had a rep help me because I have tech anxiety lol and she was so kind. I am so happy I went with this insurance. There is an insurance offered at the hospital we go to...they sell it as an insurance while you are vulnerable but it really is just a discount on the bill, small and then you pay payments with high interest. I was so flabbergasted.  I'm so happy we signed up with ASPCA PET HEALTH INSURANCE. They really do care about pets and their families
title: Rest assured with ASPCA Pet Insurance

text: I had been paying for injury and illness insurance for my cat from the age of four (he's eight now). Until recently, I had never really had to claim for any of my animals, so my husband made fun of me for this extra expense. July 2nd of this year, my cat stopped eating. After 6 weeks of diagnostic wonder and testing (and, in total, over $6k in bills), he recently came back positive for stomach cancer. Without ASPCA health insurance, we would have never been able to afford the diagnostic testing that allowed us to consider all of our treatment options for our beloved pet. They approved claims within about two weeks, and we had reimbursement checks within the month (often sooner). They're even covering (90%) the OTC and prescription meds he needs between appointments. If I would recommend anything to loving pet owners, it would be to get health insurance for their pets. It made the difference in my family.

text: This pet insurance doesn‚Äôt care about you or your loved one, and they definitely do not want to give you any money. It has been almost a month and they still haven‚Äôt reimbursed me on anything, they have actually put the processing on hold twice for the same claim to wait for more information even though they have already been sent everything 2 weeks prior. They‚Äôre trying to avoid reimbursing me on anything, and they‚Äôre trying to link any symptom to my dogs‚Äô current illness so that it can be considered a pre-existing condition. Just as a warning, they take at least 2 weeks to process your claims. If your pet needs surgery, you still need to pay out of pocket and then they‚Äôll reimburse after 2 weeks...maybe...they‚Äôll most likely try to tell you it was a pre-existing condition and they won‚Äôt give you a penny. text: Let me you about my experience as a loyal ASPCA Pet Health Insurance policy for 11 YEARS. I was just bullied and threatened by an agent/underwrite. I called asking about coverage benefits for my dog "who is 11, pushing 12, and not getting around as well as normal" I was told that my dog would have a preexisting condition and therefore ineligible for alternative care. I asked what preexisting condition. The AGENT - NOT the VET - then diagnosed my dog as "arthritic." I countered and said that the dog has NEVER EVEN been seen for ARTHRITIS. The agent/underwriter then made a threatening statement and said that I had admitted my dog wasn't moving around as fast as normal and that the underwriters will review this phone call and any veterinary notes. If there is one mention of "arthritis" she told me the animal will not qualify for a comprehensive plan that covers alternative therapy. What a rip. And to think I've actually recommended this corporate, monster machine (that preys on the emotions of pet owners) to others. NEVER. AGAIN. ASPCA, I hope your'e recording.
title: Threatened and Bullied by Agent/Underwriter

text: Saying, "I love my dog", is an understatement. Anyone who knows me knows that. He is my gift from God! All the people around me kept wondering why I would spend the money on insurance for a healthy, spoiled, inside dog. I am a planner and always try to plan for the unexpected. As a puppy, he was insured by PETCO's Banfield insurance. I soon learned after they broke his jaw during a routine dental cleaning, that this was just wellness care. Xrays,  ct scans,  operations,  are not covered. I found ASPCA online with several other insurance options.  My choice was made when the agent said to me "If you want a vodoo shaymin to say a healing prayer over Bear, it's covered. I took a chance because of that conversation and that they are animal advocates. On March 23, 2019, My 10 year old shih tzu Bear was diagnosed with lung carcinoma after being rushed to an ER. The doctor gave my baby 4 weeks...if that! All I wanted and prayed for was for me to have him for his 11th birthday May. With meds and a great Vet, he was playing at the park with me and even on my birthday at the end of May. It is the end of July and he is a little slower but still here with me. There is no way I would have been able to afford his procedures and medications. THEY HAVE HONORED EVERYTHING THAT THEY HAVE TOLD ME! My heart wth 4 legs is still here because of his ASPCA insurance.
title: ASPCA has given me more time with my dog

text:
I have a 6.5 year old french bulldog who was insured by Nationwide through my job's old benefit offering. When they switched to new medical plan, they were no longer a partner with Nationwide so I was on a new hunt for pet insurance for my pup.

I did extensive research and decided to go with ASPCA. My dog has been healthy most of her life, with only minor issues such as allergies...however, as soon as I switched over to this insurance, we started having a few medical issues with her which at first seemed like scary health scares. Let's just say in my first 3 months of ASPCA, we had over $1,500 of vet bills from emergency visits. ASPCA was very quick to review and approve all claims. I was honestly, shocked. I was sure they would give us issues since we've only been on the plan for a few months, but they didn't...at all. I uploaded all of our bills, posted all the explanations and all of my claims were processed between 1-2 weeks.

I have heard horror stories about insurance companies denying coverage for a multitude of crazy reasons and as nervous as I was about ASCPA, I couldn't be happier about my choice. I am hoping that they will continue providing the level of support as they have these last few months, for the rest of my dog's life. 

I should also add that for a 6.5 year old french bulldog, her plan is comparable in price (note- it's not cheap, but neither is any other company for a middle aged pure bred dog( to some of the more expensive insurance companies, but she gets much more coverage through ASPCA for what I pay than with any of the other competitors. ASPCA also does not consider a condition preexisting if the animal hasn't shown symptoms of it in 6+ months, which is unheard of in this industry.
title: I have a 6.5 year old french bulldog‚Ä¶

Easy submission of records then as treatment began within two weeks of me uploading pics from my phone of bills, 90% (minus the deductible from first bill) of bill was easily deposited directly into our checking account! Always someone there to answer questions at customer service. After our dog passed they covered 90% of all cremation expenses. When we notified them of our dog passing they explained they would retroactively refund partial month‚Äôs premium. Days later they called to see how we were doing and expressed their condolences again. It was amazing to have an insurance company be so easy to deal with and not to have financial worries during this whole heart wrenching ordeal! Can‚Äôt say enough about this great company and staff!!

text:
Incredibly happy and satisfied with ASPCA. We decided to get pet insurance for our German Shepherd puppy when he was about 12 weeks old. ASPCA is a little more expensive than other plans, but it has been well worth it.

Our puppy had to go to the emergency room and was hospitalized for several days. It was stressful and would have been even worse if we had to figure out how to pay for his treatment out of pocket. We were glad that we didn't have to make any decisions based on financial constraints and could just give him all the extra care he needed.

Submitting claims is easy online, and we received the reimbursement within a couple weeks. We decided not to get preventative care, but in hindsight we wish we had, as our little guy has been high maintenance. When we come up for renewal, I will probably add the preventative care. If I had to do it again, I would have gotten the insurance before I even got our dog, so we could have used all the preventative care allowances from the beginning.
title: Incredibly happy and satisfied with‚Ä¶

I cannot tell you much better the plan I have is than the one that only paid usual and customary.  This plan pays off the invoice.  If you can afford or just have one dog I would definitely suggest this plan

text: ASPCA Pet Health Insurance has been there for me and my dog in every capacity since I signed with them.  Their website is VERY user friendly and whenever I needed help, I was never on hold for more than a minute. After my very first claim, once they had access to my dog's medical history, the claims get processed super fast.  They are true to their word if your pet has been symptom/treatment free for 6 months, they do not considerate it pre-existing! I have been with 3 other pet insurance companies in the past 12 years so I can say with confidence that ASPCA Pet Health Insurance is top notch.  I can only say good things about this company.

text:
Absolutely love this insurance carrier!   I have nothing but wonderful things to say about APSCA. My dog has been suffering from chronic diarrhea (with blood) About a month or so after I signed up for the plan and I've been in/out of the vet seeking answers/treatment for her. She seems to be doing better as long as she's on the metronidazole (antibiotics) 3x a day along with a high end probiotic and prescription food. As soon as I try to lower the antibiotic dose, she ends up with the diarrhea again,  so she she's basically been on this antibiotic for 3 months while having x-rays, ultrasound and upper/lower GI scope in hopes to find the underlying cause of the chronic diarrhea.  If only you could imagine the stress that I've been dealing with these last few months (not knowing why or what is causing this problem, but also knowing my baby is in some sort of discomfort). At the same time, I am truly thankful for the amount of coverage (saved me a lot of money) that the ASPCA has helped me & my fur-baby. In addition to actual coverage,  I must say that their customer service is amazing too!  Shelly (customer service rep) Called to check in with me to see how my dog was doing due to the claims that I had been submitting and she was very genuine and showed a great deal of sympathy for what my dog was going through.  I even received a card wishing my dog well! 
My only complaint would be, having issues setting up direct deposit via the App. Since I had Shelly on the line and addressed the direct deposit issue, she offered to manually enter  my account information on her end for me ( and it worked because my next claim was direct deposited into my account). Since Shelly activated the direct deposit for me, I have been getting the direct deposit within  24-48 hours after my claim(s) are completed. 
From my point of view, I believe whatever negative feedback that you see on here about coverage is due to pre-existing  conditions and that some folks are just upset that ASPCA won't cover it. It clearly states if your animal has been seen in the past for this problem...it is considered "pre-existing!"
When I first started submitting my claims, I noticed it took several weeks along with another 2 weeks before i would get a reimbursement check. Although, I noticed the last few claims they are being processed a lot quicker (4-5 days & 24-48 hrs after for the direct deposit). I'm assuming that since they can see the previous claims and the history with my dogs chronic diarrhea that maybe it makes the process easier for them?! 
As far as moving forward with ASPCA... As long as my annual premium doesn't go up tremendously,  I plan on remaining a customer of ASPCA forever!  Again, I am HIGHLY impressed with their service and couldn't be more happier with my pick of insurance (I'm sure you won't be either!). 
I will continue to recommend ASPCA insurance to anyone that has a pet(s)!
title: Absolutely love this insurance carrier!

text: I have been using this insurance for both of my dogs since 2012. When they say they will cover 90% of your pet's accidents, injuries and illnesses, that is not exactly true. Since I began using this insurance in 2012, the plans have changed and now they offer better plans than what I currently have. For instance, they will cover 90% of the "average cost" of treatment for my pets in my area and not the "actual cost" of treatment. The average cost for my area is never anywhere close to being 90% of what I pay at the vet. When I called to inquire about upgrading to the newer plans that base your reimbursement off of the actual cost instead of the average cost, they basically said if my dogs have any issues going forward, in relation to what they have covered with this older plan, they will no longer cover it because it will then be considered "pre-existing" even though I was insured by them at the time of the initial diagnoses. However, if I keep the current plan, they will still cover any issues that arise, based solely off of the "average cost."  Considering one of my dogs has torn both ACL's and both Meniscus ligaments while being insured under the older plan, I am too scared to upgrade and then she have a complication in regards to those 4 major knee surgeries down the road. When speaking with Sarah, who works in the "Questions About Claims" department over the phone about how this is not a loyal program to clients who have been with them for several years, her response was "Well it is better that we cover something rather than nothing at all." The way I see it is that I am paying $67/month, my dogs most recent vet bill was $862 and they only reimbursed me $462. If I put $67/month in an account for my dogs each month instead of sending it to insurance then I would come out much cheaper than taking the chance of insurance not covering the bills. My biggest complaint is that they do not have any type of loyalty to customers such as myself, who has been with them for 7 years now and for me customer service is everything. Without great customer service and the willingness to take care of your long term clients, how can you expect to keep those clients?
title: Not Loyal to Long-Term Members

Great insurance that you can configure to your pocket and risk.

The one area that could be handled better is when things go off piste. Delays in processing aren‚Äôt advertised so you end up wasting time following up with the company to be told there is an additional three week processing time!

text:
BUYER BEWARE!! ASPCA Pet Insurance does not offer "continuing care" for many pets and they are not straight forward about it until it's too late. When my cat was diagnosed with cancer after being with them for years, they stopped covering any related care after a year. ASPCA Pet Insurance abandons you and your pets when you need them most just to line their pockets.

Edit to add a response: I was never offered continuing care and had I known this would happen I would never have worked with your company. Thanks to ASPCA Insurance I can no longer get coverage for my sick and dying cat because he now has a pre-existing condition. I don‚Äôt know how I can continue to pay for his treatments now. I also called around and found that other pet insurance companies don‚Äôt pull this trick on their customers. ASPCA Pet Insurance preys on customers with sick and dying pets.
title: ASPCA Leaves You When Your Pet Is Dying

text: We give 0 stars.  We had 3 cats on your insurance.  We had just insured our 3rd kitten and she got sick before the grace period ended and we did not officially pursue reimbursement.  She was diagnosed with an infection, treated and recovered.  In September, she got sick again, was treated, sent home and brought back the next day because she was weaker.  She was referred to another vet, but was never diagnosed with anything because she was too weak to be tested.  We agreed to extra treatment and tried to save her because we "had" insurance.  Reimbursement was denied because of a pre existing condition?  How do we know???  She was never tested for anything and the first issue was an infection...not a disease.  How would you know that?  We did not pursue reimbursement in March.  This was over $4500.  We feel very ripped off.

text: My family has had over 11 years of experience with this pet health insurance company and throughout those 11 rollercoaster years they have been less than satisfactory. After doing my research and speaking with multiple pet owners, vets, lawyers and other insurance companies, ASPCA Pet Health Insurance has inadequate and outdated policies which luckily for them, cover very little in your pets health. They conspicuously leave out some of the most important aspects of a pet's welfare and allow you to pay an exorbitant amount of money for insurance that has a lot of inconsistencies and holes. We will never regret providing the necessary healthcare to our dear boy Hance, no matter what the cost, but we will certainly not be using this company for any further assistance. There are many other pet insurance companies that are honest, forthcoming with information, with better and more complete coverage and are less expensive than ASPCA.
title: Sadly, One of The Worst!

text: ASPCA pet insurance is the only one that considers a pre-existing condition cured if there are no symptoms for 180 days.  All other insurances say that once there are symptoms or a diagnosis the condition is not covered.

text: I used to like ASPCA pet insurance but not anymore. They have a fraudulent way of denying claims based on the fact that they start the new plan each year and any claim made in the previous calendar year does not get reimbursed. Let's say your pet gets symptoms on July 31st. Your new calendar year plan starts August 1st. That is the day you take him to the vet. According to ASPCA Pet insurance, the symptoms were in the previous year and wouldn't be considered for reimbursement. This is the most insane thing I ever heard. Like someone can plan illness or accident according to a calendar. I am filing a complaint with the Better Business Bureau about these fraudulent practices. They used to be great but the last 3 years I have had the insurance they have reimbursed me NOTHING for hundreds of dollars of claims for new illnesses.
title: I used to like ASPCA pet insurance but‚Ä¶

text: My experience with this pet insurance company has been a complete nightmare.  I signed my dachshund up with ASPCA in August 1st of 2016.  My dog Winston was 9 years old at the time and had no preexisting conditions.  In the past two years the plan has gone up in price substantially (I started out paying $36.00 a month and I now pay $56.00 a month).  Now get this.  It is June of this year when my dog got diagnosed with Lymphoma (a quick growing cancer that has a prognosis of two months).  For the first time in Winston's life he has an illness that is severe and needs significant treatment.  At this point I am overjoyed that I have put so much money into a pet insurance company that has a limit of $3,000 dollars in order to help prolong Winston‚Äôs life (being that I am a grad school student graduate I have significant student loan debt and this monthly $56.00 of allotted money that I was putting towards my pet insurance was precious and significant).  Because of ASPCA‚Äôs policy that refuses to provide reimbursement for continued treatment after the renewal date (as in‚Äîbecause I started my pet insurance on August 1st, they refuse to reimburse me should Winstons‚Äô treatment‚Äôs continue beyond this date, although the yearly limit they provide that they will reimburse towards is $3,000)  This appears to violate the agreement that I and many others might assume to exist in that they will provide reimbursement for bills accrued due to illness, accidents, etc. Their abrupt cancelations for canceling reimbursement for my dogs treatment appeared callous and cold as well as only covered two chemotherapy treatments out of the minimum of five that were recommended.  My vet (Dr. Lauren Silverman, DVM) at Healthy Pet‚Äôs Veterinary Hospital in the West Portal District of San Francisco (where Winston was diagnosed with lymphoma), as well as my current Oncologist (Dr. Bryan Marker DVM, DACVIM) have expressed their dismay and disrespect for the insurance companies apparent disregard for their abrupt cessation of reimbursement support for vet bills right before a renewal date.  Had Winston been diagnosed with cancer in September, he would have had 11 months of reimbursable treatments that could have prolonged his life (as Winston was responding favorably to the chemotherapy).  I am extremely disappointed that the massive fine print in the ASPCA pet insurance allows them to feel compelled to not reimburse me for any treatment taking place after August 3rd when my pet insurance is renewed.  The vets that have grown to love Winston have decided to stop recommending ASPCA pet insurance to their patients due to the numerous loop holes which allow them to escape responsibility for reimbursing for vet bills. That said, some companies use benefit schedules or ‚Äúusual and customary‚Äù charges to determine how much they‚Äôll reimburse. The issue with these reimbursements is that the company sets a limit for how much they‚Äôll pay based on your pet‚Äôs diagnosis. That means if your vet happens to charge more than what they have designated for that condition, you‚Äôll end up footing the difference like I have done all too often with this pet insurance.   I have now only been reimbursed $1,038 dollars an entire month after submitting my claim for $1,300.  Not only has this pet insurance nickeled and dimed me as much as possible, but they have made it so I am now paying even MORE based on the interest this amount has accrued on my credit card.  I too must speak out against this grave injustice that I feel I have experienced at the detriment of my pet‚Äôs lifespan.  I am crying writing this review, knowing my baby has only about a month left and has already started to decline dramatically due to his cancer tumors returning.  I only hope that this review can assist someone who loves their pet the way that I do in making a better pet insurance decision.
title: Underwritings and Fine Print- How ASPCA scams their customers

text: Signing up for the insurance was easy & monthly premiums are deducted from my checking account promptly on the due date. It's not like they have to research the claim as they have a specific reimbursement schedule for wellness.  I insure my three pets through three different companies & ASPCA is hands down the worst when it comes to claims processing!!  If you expect decent turnaround time on your claims I recommend you stay away for this company.

text:
When my senior dog rapidly became seriously ill, we made many trips to our regular vet and a few consults with specialists. After many diagnostic tests and procedures, we ended up with diagnosis of T-cell lymphoma. After six weeks of watching him lose his will to continue, I made the most difficult decision to let him go peacefully. I considered surgery to remove his spleen, but it was clear other organs were also involved in the disease process. Chemotherapy was another option I considered. At best, it would have extended life for 6-8 months. I weighed that against quality of life and opted to abandon all treatment.                                                                     
ASPCA was with me every step of the painful journey. My claims were processed efficiently (and correctly) and the numerous claims representatives I spoke with were genuinely empathetic and comforting. Couldn't ask for more...
title: Exemplary Service

text: My 4 month old St. Bernard puppy came down with what we thought was a routine illness, in a terrible turn of events it evolved into a life threatening issue.  Over the course of 4 weeks and many hospitalizations the veterinarians pulled out all the stops to help get our puppy well, miraculously they succeeded at no small cost.  Whether we had insurance or not we would have done exactly the same thing.  BUT having this insurance gave us one less thing to worry about and therefore our focus was on getting our boy well.  I submitted all my claims and within 2 weeks exactly my claims were paid out without any additional hassle.  ASPCA kept me informed via email what was happening, when they reached out to the vets for additional information, really didn't need to disturb us at all, everything was handled beautifully behind the scenes.  I actually have spoken to friends, family and colleagues about our recent ordeal (even today as a matter of fact) and told them how great ASPCA was in handling all claims, even when I called to enroll my other dogs, the representative upon pulling up our account, immediately asked how our puppy was doing - this is true customer service.  I don't have enough words or phrases to truly appreciate the quality of service and the attention that ASPCA provides their customers.  You would be crazy to go anywhere else for your pets insurance needs.
title: BEST PET INSURANCE BAR NONE

text: This is the easiest insurance I've ever used! It covers a percentage of routine exams, medication and diagnostics. As every pet owner knows these expenses add up quickly when you have multiple and/or older dogs. My vet submits the claims for me, which makes it even easier to use. The few times I've had to submit a claim myself (emergency vet), it was also a very simple process. You submit the claim, get an email confirming the receipt of your claim and also to let you know it's been approved. Check comes in the mail within 7-10 days. As my older dog, Maxi, needs more care, this has literally been a life-saver. Thank you, ASPCA Health Insurance!
title: Insurance you can use

text: They are always caring for your pet making sure to keep up to date with their health....Thank you.
title: They are always caring for your pet‚Ä¶

text:
My pup had her second TPLO (a major knee surgery, and yes, a genetic issue) about a year a few months after the first surgery. ASPCA covered 90% of all fees less the $250 deductible! Not only that but I filed the claim on a Monday and received the money in my account that Friday! It was quick, easy and the service I signed up to a "T"! I have recommended them to multiple people I know with fur babies and will continue to do so!

After reading a ton of reviews (after I had already carried insurance with ASPCA for over a year) I was really nervous I would not get to utilize the insurance. Many reviews make the process sound difficult or like they actually wouldn't cover much/will fight you regardless as to the plan. 

I honestly think people either have the wrong plan for what they are attempting to cover, did not read the fine print regarding covering certain conditions in certain time frames (my dog had to go 6 months without incident from the first surgery to be covered for the second) or simply did not file their claim with all the necessary documents (ie: a year of medical records, itemized bills, etc...) in a timely enough manner. This stuff is all lain out on the website so I'm not sure how someone could miss it but read it carefully!!!

This process was easy, quick and efficient. It took a TON of stress off of me to know I wasn't spending $4000 for the second time in less than 2 years on a surgery. Highly recommend!
title: Exactly What I Signed up for!

ASPCA insurance even allowed me to take my sweet Molly to the MU veterinary college for advanced treatment when she needed it. It was such a HUGE blessing to be able to focus on Molly and not how I was going to pay for her care. Sadly, my Molly passed in March of 2017. I recently was paired with a successor Diabetic Alert dog named BATMAN who, of course, is now insured with ASPCA Pet Health Insurance as well. Keep you the great work! Your service is allowing animals the care they deserve in a way that people can afford! Many, many thanks! Debe

text: I have had ASPCA Pet Insurance for a very long time. The little furry baby princess girl I insure is now my 13 year old puppy person, not my 3 year old puppy person any more,  which is when I rescued her, at the age of 3.  In  turn ASPCA rescued her through many a tumultuous time. 40 stones in all her female organs,  polyps she needed removed,  a broken leg shattered so badly that she has a plate where her femur was with 12 pins keeping it in step with her. As she's gotten older the problems we all have she has as well..And, I do not think she'd be here without the financial help ASPCA has blessed me with. I could never ever see myself without ASPCA ever again. With my girl & furry kids that will undoubtedly be in our future,  ASPCA will be part of their lives too. No one paid me,  or offered me anything for a favorable review so please be advised this honest & candid recantation was not written because I had to but because I wanted to & felt I needed to. I'm grateful to them & I know I'm also beyond the point of ever repaying their gratitude but let me say it again, they've saved me every single time they help my girl. For without her I don't know what I'd do  but thank heavens I don't have to think about leaving ASPCA. They are a gift & the people that work for them are just angels & I may be gushing & for that I apologize but they deserve it,  one & all.
title: This insurance saved my dogs life

text:
On October 28, 2017 my dog tore his ACL on his right knee and required surgery.  After the sticker shock from that experience, I decide to sign up for pet insurance through ASPCA.  When I signed up for pet insurance on November 17, 2017 with ASPCA, the grace period on the application for future claims was 24 hours.  

Unfortunately, my dog fell and dislocated his knee cap on November 20, 2017.  After his surgery I submitted a claim to ASPCA thinking he was covered.  ASPCA rejected the claim saying the grace period was 14 days.  Do not trust ASPCA with your pets health.

text: I got my first policy two years ago for my four-year-old cat. I had never had insurance before and was not anticipating any health issues with my cat. He became very ill very suddenly and required medical attention and multiple tests. I was so upset that I forgot I had insurance and forgot to place the claim. I finally did place the claim and they were understanding about the time lapse.  I was reimbursed much more than I had ever anticipated and was very pleased. The claim was processed quickly and someone even called to apologize about the death of my pet. They didn‚Äôt want anything at all, no additional information or anything, just simply called to apologize about the loss of my pet. I was very impressed. I have since gotten two more cats and have ensured them both through ASPCA as well as recommending it to my friends and family. I hope I never need it again, but at least I have it in case I do.

text: I adopted a 3 year old dog and purchased insurance with ASPCA. He was completely healthy as a young dog. A while later he began limping. We were asked if a specific accident caused it, and we weren't sure because he plays with our son, he plays in our fenced in yard, we don't watch him 24/7-we just knew he started limping suddenly so it's highly likely some accident caused it, we just don't know what accident? Jumping off the couch? Running and tripping on a ditch? Chasing a cat? Who knows?  So we took him to the vet, they x-rayed him and stated that an injury caused his limping noting something about a possible small fracture and deemed it as arthritis due to an injury. They refused to cover it because they said they don't know if the injury occurred before we got insurance or not. Well, he's three. There are a lot of things that could have happened prior to adopting him but one thing is certain-he wasn't limping and then he was. My insurance covered accidents and injuries yet they refused to cover it at all. Additionally, the plan option coverage costs were expensive. Over $40 a MONTH for full coverage. I cancelled my plan, unfortunately. I know insurance companies not covering claims is nothing new, it was just really disappointing because they were recommended by a family member.
title: I adopted a 3 year old dog and ‚Ä¶

text: I first insured a dog with ASPCA Pet Health Insurance 8 or 9 years ago. It was always easy to access a representative when I had questions or wanted to make a change to the policy. Every representative I talked to was knowledgeable and personable. Filing a claim was also easy to do, and I could count on the refund for the portion of the medical expenses covered arriving in a timely manner. When my dog passed away, and I canceled the policy, I was moved by the sincere sympathy expressed by the representatives I talked to. I decided to continue to cover my dogs with ASPCA. I cherish that the company is constantly improving and making filing claims even more streamlined. Recently, I was at a vet with a dog, who just became a part of our family. They presented me with discounts for other pet insurance policies. Curious, I called to see what they had to offer. After the two very confusing explanations of benefits and rather pushy sales reps, I realized that I have chosen correctly and have the best coverage available for my dogs. I only wish they insured horses!

text: ASPCA pet health insurance has been very beneficial to have throughout the years of my continued dogs life.  My dog is a 9 year old boxer and has had several minor health issues prior to this past year.  However, this past year she's had a couple of more serious health issues.  A tumor on one of her toes that was cancerous, but my vet was able to cure her by amuptating the toe.  The other being dental disease, which my vet had to extract several teeth.  Fortunately my boxer was able to heal and fully recover from all of her health issues.  My pet insurance gave no issues for the most part and took care of 80% of the majority of the costs. ASPCA made follow up phone calls to see how my dog was doing after the surgeries too, which I thought was very thoughtful.  The only negative is that my pet insurance was about $30 per month when I first got the insurance and it is now $60 per month.  Keep in mind the breed of the dog and the level of the plan.  I do not have the highest level.  Although I'm not to happy about the monthly charge increasing so much, it does help when a serious injury or health concern arises.  It makes decision making so much easier because ASPCA is really good with compensation depending on the level of your plan.

text: I recommend this insurance all the time!I paid for insurance for years hoping that I'd never need it! All those years, I thought the deductible was per occurrence. My dog had some illnesses. I paid for myself like a urinary infection and an ear infection. Last year, my dog cut her paw pad. I was reimbursed minus the $100 deductible. So, it wasn't much, But then she hurt her knee the month, actually about a week before her new benefit year began, In hindsight, had I known it was not a life emergency, I would have given her more time To rest and maybe recover? She was in so much pain, couldn't walk at all! The surgery was awful. Muscle atrophy was almost immediate! Recovery was months!! I had to stay home. Not work for months! Sadly, statistically, the other knee gets damaged from overuse. Bless her heart. It's been a nightmare! I waited about six months to turn in claims. The first ones were handled quickly because I had the records. Remember, what happens in a different benefit year is NOT covered later. I am glad I paid for the continuing care option but it's nor that helpful. The continuing care is only $1000, OH and the deductible!! Not sure it was even worth paying for another year, They've stopped paying halfway through and I will post if they do not renew her insurance. They've made more money off me than I've been reimbursed.... of course! READ your policy and asked lots of questions! Best wishes! It is what is... business!  ; ) I just live without cable tv LOL :)  Sissy Sweet is worth a million dollars, to me!!! <3
title: I recommend this insurance all the ‚Ä¶

I really appreciate that part!  
I have been VERY satisfied with the amount they pay on each bill.  They review the statements promptly, and notify me immediately when one of the submissions has been completed.  I really have nothing but good things to say about this company -- after all, they're associated with ASPCA, who I trust is doing all they can to protect and help animals, a cause near and dear to my heart!

text: We got our puppy insured with ASPCA Pet Health Insurance the day after getting him and am SO relieved to have done so right away. Not only are we relieved to have gotten him insured right away, but to have picked the right pet insurance. Unexpectedly, our little guy incurred an accident that nearly killed him five days after getting him. As devastated as we were, it helped to know that we had pet insurance to help with the financial burden of a puppy being hospitalized for three days. Within one week of submitting our puppy's claim, ASPCA sent us a check covering the agreed upon services in our contract. Today we have a happy, healthy pup and praise God that we had the foresight to not only get insurance, but to have picked a company that would take care of us in our time of dire need. We highly recommend ASPCA Pet Insurance and want to say "THANK YOU!"

text:
When my dog needed emergency surgery, it was a relief when I could tell my veterinarian that whatever my dog needed, he could do, because I had health insurance for my dog.

My dog had surgery on Sunday morning, on Wednesday morning I uploaded the documents to the ASPCA Pet Health Insurance website, and on Friday, I received notification that his claim had been approved. I received the check the next week.

I simply can not imagine an easier process. I can't tell you how much I love this health insurance. It is such a good investment because you never know what your pets will do!

As a side note, I work at an SPCA and I told everyone how great working with the insurance is and I believe a few of my co-workers signed up for it!

I couldn't be happier with my decision to go with this insurance! Thank you, thank you!
title: When my dog needed emergency surgery, I was glad I had ASPCA Pet Health Insurance!

text: I have now insured 5 cats with ASPCA (3 now deceased) and I have been extremely satisfied.  Unlike a lot of insurance companies whose motto on paying claims is deny, deny, deny, ASPCA has always been more than fair.  Two of my cats lived to the ages of 17 and 18 respectively, and Vet care at that age can get expensive and having insurance to mitigate the cost of their end of life care is a lifesaver.  Of course, the insurance also paid for illnesses and dental extractions earlier in my cats' lives which was also helpful.  I recently added another cat (a 2-year-old) to my ASPCA insurance because I want her to be covered from the start and I believe that it is only fair to the insurance company to insure the cats when they are young in order to pay off later when they are older and their health eventually deteriorates.  I want to mention 1 more aspect and that when I have called up to notify ASPCA Insurance when a cat dies, each time the person who took the call has sent me a personalized sympathy card and that has meant a lot to me as a grieving cat parent.  I whole heartedly recommend ASPCA Pet Health Insurance.
title: ASPCA Insurance Protects My Cats
