text:
I've had nothing but great experiences with ASPCA Pet Health Insurance personnel, in both good times and bad. I had injury insurance on my cat Scotty, who had some pre-existing health conditions when I joined the company. I never had to use the insurance, but when Scotty died last August and I informed the CSR, I was treated with such kindness and compassion. The individual, whose name I don't remember, was genuine in expressing sympathy, and I received credit on my premium within a few short days. A week or so later, I received a condolence note, again sympathetic and genuine. I was touched, and the note is tucked away with other messages I received from friends and family. So that wonderful experience has brought me back, now that I have two beautiful new kittens to keep me on my toes! 
Sassenach and Sable are strong and healthy, and I hope never to have to use your services. But I know that if that situation arises, ASPCA will be there to provide the care and protection my kittens are entitled to.

text: When I first began using ASPCA Pet Health Insurance, I selected them for 2 primary reasons: affordability and reasonable waiting periods for the policy to take effect. In the past, I have only used pet insurance for small things in the past: vet visit, shots, flea medication. This is great coverage for that plus more - my first claim for my pet was for an abscessed wound; the process to file a claim was simple and straightforward, although I felt it took a bit long to get the refund. That aside, the second time I had to take my pet in for poisoning, again the ease of filing a claim was simple, a customer service rep even called to check up on us and see how we were doing, and this time, the return was processed quickly and the waiting time I had experienced has been shorted significantly. I used to use VPI Pet - I would now say that ASPCA Pet Health Insurance is the go-to! I highly recommend them!

text: I have two dogs, one that was insured with ASPCA, and another with Pets Best.  The costs are the same, but the coverage is very different.  Both of my dogs have long-term care illnesses (Addison's disease, and Irritable Bowel Disease).  ASPCA has a lifetime cap of $2500 for continuing care.  That amount only lasted three years, and now all expenses are out of pocket.  Pets Best has no lifetime cap on continuing care, which is a relief for a dog that has an illness that will last his entire life.  There are far better insurance plans for your pets than ASPCA, which was a surprise to me because of all providers, I would expect better coverage from a charity that prides itself on care for animals.  Unfortunately, because my dog insured with ASPCA now has a chronic illness, I cannot change policies because she has a pre-existing condition.
title: Caps on annual or long-term illnesses far too low

text: I have only had this insurance maybe 6 months. My dachshund ended up having a bowel obstruction and needed life-saving surgery. I was able to borrow the money to pay the surgeon and then receive payment from ASPCA Insurance within 10 days of claim allowing me to immediately pay back everyone who assisted me. When the blockage was discovered he had already been to the vet for treatment earlier, at that time the blockage wasn't found. ASPCA Insurance made sure that both claims were handled together so that there was not an additional deductible applied. They were so wonderful throughout the process and even called to see how Max was doing after the fact.
title: Great Customer Service and Quick response

text: Our dog Shela was diagnosed with diabetes last June 2016. She was started on insulin. We had to take her to vet every 3-4 weeks to have blood glucose checked. Then the vet suggested a different insulin which initially seemed more expensive at $250 but it lasted just short of 3 months. I put claims in to ASPCA and they paid a good part of the amount claim. Someone called to see how Shela was doing. I haven't called them back yet because I was out of town.

text:
We have two GSD mixes, a 3 year old and a 10 month pup. Our puppy Abbey started limping one day so we watched her for about 3 weeks, it came and went but seemed to progressively get worse. We asked our daycare , whom are trainers, what they thought and they mentioned perhaps lyme diasease. This of course triggered a trip to vet. All tests were neg. but the limp persisted. While playing in the yard shortly there after Abbey yelped and began to really favor the leg which led to another trip to the vet. It was recommended that we get X-rays of her leg the following day so loving our dog that is what we did. All the while we were worried wether or not our ASPCA Insurance would be there for us in this situation. Again all X-rays were neg and she was put on an anti inflammatory which seemed to help. I submitted all the claims not knowing exactly what was going to happen. I am very happy to say that ASPCA Insurance was with us all the way. The peace of mind I get knowing that is immeasurable. At no time will the health and wellbeing of my pet be something I must worry about with ASPCA on my side. Thank You ASPCA!
P.S. Abbey is doing fine now and driving us crazy we love it!

text:
I've been delighted with ASPCA Pet Health Insurance. I have a large pitbull mix named Waldo, who had needed veterinary care a number of times in the last year. Unfortunately, we had to change vets three times before finding one that was a good fit for Waldo. Since his medical history is sparse, I wasn't aware that he has adverse reactions to many drugs, as well as a very sensitive stomach.

ASPCA Pet Health Insurance has been great, covered all Waldo's care according to the plan I purchased and called to follow up each claim to see how he was doing and if everything was okay. Payment was made quickly and no questions, even though the changing of vets and treatment for reaction to medications must have seemed confusing.

My mother has pet insurance through another company and her experience with them has been a nightmare, with claims always rejected or questioned and every attempt made to minimize payouts. She's about to get with ASPCA Pet Health Insurance instead. I would recommend them without reservation. Two thumbs up!
title: It's a winner!

title: Dependable

text:
Four years ago I rescued a hulking big cat that is about 6 years old now, and appropriately named Sampson. All was fine the first 2 years, then bad things started to happen.  He had a blocked urethra twice, the first one nearly killing him, Then there was a bacterial infection in his stomach and, perhaps, because of the needed meds, we found his liver numbers were over the moon.  Prescription drugs did not stop the soaring numbers and as a last resort we put him on Milk Thistle and his numbers were almost normal in 2 weeks. Now we are working on finding out what is causing his high white blood count.  Thousands have been spent on x-rays, medications, scans and exams and without ASPCA, this boy would not be here now because I'm on SS and could never afford all that he needed and would have had to put him down.  I love this company. The people I've talked to have been wonderful and truly concerned.  They even call to see how he is doing. AND, the reimbursement check(s) arrive in a timely manner. Even my Vet is amazed as he was the one who endorsed you, and is pretty happy about that. (He was getting too many complaints from clients about the prior company he had endorsed and had heard about you from other patients.)  So keep up the good work so that we can all sleep at night!!   (We all know that nothing bad happens at 11:000 a.m on a Tuesday.)

So, God Bless you all for being so good to all of your clients, both pets and parents, and keeping your prices at a rate that even someone on SS can afford.

P.S.  I refer your company to everyone I know who has a pet.  Don't know if they have signed up, but they will wish they had if something bad happens.
title: My cat would have died if it were not for ASPCA

text: Very happy with the service provided. A definite must for pet owners.
title: Claims processed promptly

text: I have had my dog insured with Petshealth Care Plan for 16 years now, and recommend it to anyone who asks. Sure there are years when I pay more in premiums then I get back, but the same goes with my own health insurance. Having pet insurance means piece of mind in knowing that when my dog tore his ACL and was in pain and needed surgery and PT, that I was going to be getting back 80% (of the usual and customary charges) and that helped immensely in deciding to do the surgery. As the years have gone on, and knowing that I will not be putting my aging dog through surgery anymore, I was able to customize his insurance level and just have a basic plan that covers accidents and illness. I will not lie... over the years the premiums have increased alot, but for me it has been money well spent. Claims are processed pretty quickly and although I have had some issues with the amount of records my vet has had to provide each time I submit a claim, I am very satisfied with Petshealth Care Plan and would insure any future dog with them.
title: Pet insurance is piece of mind

text: The best experience. My reimbursement was more than I expected. The time frames were short and quick and customer service was wonderful.

I have NEVER missed my monthly premium and this is the first claim I've ever submitted.  You've got to be kidding me! They know how to take my money, just not reimburse for a completely covered expense.  I am packing up and taking my money to another pet insurance.  Seriously...do not waste your time and money.  I am also filing a complaint with my state division of insurance.  This is fraud and I'm not letting them get away with it.

text: My experience with ASPCA Pet Health Insurance for the past year has been mixed.  The online claim process and direct deposit reimbursement is extremely convenient, and they make sure to keep track of each claim and follow up on your pet's health and condition over the phone.  But the coverage of the policy is something that could be improved.  A lot of the expenses are not covered because of the Usual and Customary exclusions, and the policy covers only 90% of qualified expenses.  All and all, it's a good insurance that has room for improvement.
title: Not quite the best

text: The service was both incredibly helpful and caring.  I am counting my blessings that I chose this insurance!  This was a tremendous help for my cat's surgery!

Gloria Swanson and Snoopy

text: I have had ASPCA pet health insurance now for several years on 3 of my cats. It is a great insurance and easy to work with. Peace of mind is knowing when your pet is sick or injured that you can be reimbursed most of your claim and get your pet the medical attention they need without the stress of the financial burden.

text: I decided to get pet insurance about 10 years ago and over the years I have used it rarely. I debated back and forth about canceling my policy many times but I am extremely grateful that I didn't cancel. Little Mama, our shih tzu was recently diagnosed with lymphoma of the small intestine. Thankfully the cost of treatment wasn't a factor in deciding what was in her best interests because we have ASPCA insurance, what a life saver! I am happy to report that Little Mama is in remission and is as spunky as ever. ASPCA has been extremely helpful through this process and reimbursed our claims very quickly. If we did not have ASPCA insurance, Little Mama may not be with us now! I recommend ASPCA to everyone and anyone that I meet!
title: I am a huge fan of ASPCA insurance, they have been monumental in helping us afford treatment for our beloved Little Ma.

text:
I've been using ASPCA Pet Health insurance for a number of years. They are usually pretty fast at refunding expenses. I've had some major health issues with my dog throughout the years, once instance I was refunder of $5,000 and they still didn't drop me or raise the rates so high that it was not affordable any longer. They often call to check if everything went well at the vet and if I'm satisfied with the claims service.

The only minor thing is that like all other insurance providers, the amount that they allow are usually less than any good vet I've been to charges. Thankfully I have a good vet that is pretty close to the amount they charge.
title: Fast refund of claims and great service

text: It doesn't cover the dental insurance.
title: Not covering the dental which is very important for health.

text: I have had pet insurance just over a year for my dachshund.  He had always been healthy recently he ate something bad which caused sever vomiting.  That lead to bacteria in his lungs that developed into pneumonia.  He was in the Er for 4 days.  His bill ended up being $2500.  His insurance covered $1700.  That was a huge help.  I filed his claim online and had the check mailed to me in a week.  They call and check up on him to make sure he's doing better.  Glad I have pet insurance and glad it's through ASPCA.
title: Great pet insurance

text:
After paying big bucks on operations for our previous dog, we decided to go with ASPCA Pet Insurance for our new dog. We paid the insurance for 6 years thinking that perhaps we made the wrong choice. Then our much loved Shepherd got 'the bloat', a life threatening condition. ASPCA paid for nearly everything. Then a year later, she torn the ligaments in her knee. The operation brought her back to normal again. This was followed by the removal of 3 cysts a year later. ASPCA paid for most of each incident. We realized that without the insurance, we would have been asking if this was the end for our dog. 
ASPCA always calls a couple weeks after the incident to find out if everything is okay - they seem like they really care about the outcome. They don't cover everything, but when you need them the most, they are there for you. It's definitely worth it!
title: A very good program - definitely worth it!

text: We had never had pet insurance until this last almost year and a half.  After losing our Chessy to diabetic complications(I gave her insulin 2 times daily for over 4 years) we became aware of how costly an illness/injury can be. Our sweet Ovida (Ovi) was just playing in the house with our Maine Coone.   Normal daily activities but she must have twisted the wrong way and hurt her right back leg.  I watched her and rested it for 4 days but saw no improvement so went to vet.  X-ray and exam followed showing a lot of tearing of her ACL . Ovi was put on Rymidal for imflamation/pain and Ace to keep her calm.  Visited surgeon for exam and surgery followed the next day.  The insurance paid really well. We are on the 90% of usual and customary coverage. I need to to say that this is a very costly surgery, but necessary.  There were only a small handful of charges on the surgeon itemized list that were not paid at 90%. The $300+ first doctor expense was covered as was surgery and follow up medications needed to recoup. I like the fact you can log in to your account, see when received, and where they are with the process.   To expedite the payment I had the vet copy all of Ovi's records and sent with first billing.   Important to know there are some exceptions...to coverage with timelines.  ACL is a bilateral issue and there is a waiting period of a year if the pet had one before.  These are the most pleasant people to work with at ASPCA.  Every conversation has been helpful, kind and caring. I even received 2 follow up calls checking on Ovi.   Sorry so long...but I would not hesitate to go with this company.  Stellar!!! Also have our cat on program...haven't needed to use yet; ).  Peace of mind if we do.
title: Ovida'a TPLO surgery

text: I have nothing but great things to say about ASPCA Pet Health Insurance. After my dog got sick, they got my reimbursement back to me quickly. Then they called about a week later to see how she was feeling!

text: We had two cats whom we loved like children.  In 2012, our cat Simon developed diabetes and required insulin shots for several months before passing away.  In 2014, after many months of treatment for pancreatic disease, his brother Alvin passed away.  Both cats had very expensive treatment, and we learned that we would have been better off financially had we had health insurance.  We adopted two new rescue kitties in 2014 - Sherlock and Lucy Lu.  As soon as we did, we purchased ASPCA health coverage for all of our cats - the two new babies as well as Simon and Alvin's younger brother Theodore.  We have given ourselves peace of mind.  We know that we can give our cats proper health care.  Our coverage not only takes care of them when they are ill, but they are also covered for "well cat" checkups.  We love our cats like they were our children, and ASPCA Health Coverage allows us to provide proper health care for them as if they were our children.
title: I love my kitties so much ... I have purchased ASPCA Health Insurance for them

text: I first picked ASPCA for pet insurance because I like that it helps give back to the ASPCA to help other animals in need.  They have very good insurance plans, discount for multiple pets, and different tiers to choose from.  I think the best thing about them though, is that you can submit claims online on their website, you see real time status of the claim, and my most recent claims were all settled in 2 weeks time!  Money direct deposited into my bank account quickly.  That is wonderful to know when you are shelling out money for surgery for your pet.
title: Quick Claims, Great Insurance!

text: Reasonable rates and quick processing of claims.
title: Great customer service

text:
Following my first Lab's untimely rainbow bridge crossing from bone cancer almost 20 years ago, I got health insurance for my next lab, with another company. He eventually passed at the Lab-ripe age of 18 from histiosarcoma.  After 13 years dealing with that agency, coverage was denied based on fine print written in several 5-point size disclaimers allowing the company to interpret anything they wanted.  Needless to say, I will never, ever, deal with these folks again.  

Enter ASPCA Health Insurance.  I initially went in with trepidation but my vets were enthusiastic about them.  I've been with them now for seven years and it has been superb.  My dog was a rescue who had been abused and neglected so he needed extra care, initial medical treatment, etc.  Insurance coverage was excellent.  Fast forward six years and my furry son had a serious accident falling during an ice storm that made roads, driveways and our yard into an ice skating rink.  Two days of emergency care, several orthopedic specialists, pain and inflammation drug cocktails, and now therapy.

I can't extol the positives of ASPCA insurance enough.  They have been superb in every respect.  I even got a call from one of their agents as to how my dog was doing.

Reimbursement processing actions have been coming in as fast as 48 hours after claim placement.  I wish my own health insurance was that efficient.

Top notch.
title: Best reason to have insurance for your pet

It was not pre existing but was denied with that explanation because it was the same eye, so the antibiotic was not reimbursed.

title: Great customer service and fast claim process

text: My two Yellow Labs, Sparky and Pluggy receive the best of veterinary care from The Veterinary Healing Center in El Dorado Hills, California.  It was our vet that referred me to ASPCA Pet Health Insurance.  I couldn't be happier with ASPCA, as they provide me very easy access to file and track the progress of our claims, reimburse us at a reasonable and fair rate and do it in a very timely manner.  I've even received follow-up calls to ensure everything went well and we were satisfied.  I don't get that kind of service from our "human" health care provider!
title: Happy pets, happy pet owner!

text:
Most of us can recall 1 or more experiences with insurance & quite often it conjures up a negative stigma. I was less than eager about this to say the least, but the thought of even one unexpected enormous bill held an even higher priority. So I thought "What can it hurt to look at premiums/deductibles etc". I was very PLEASANTLY surprised!! 

To solidify my decision, I asked the opinions of a few very highly sought Animal Allergists  & Veterinarians. They ALL recommended ASPCA Pet Health Insurance above the others. Siting their short claim turn around, overall genuine care & concern, competency & quite a low % of client complaints.

Purchasing pet insurance was a 1st for me. In fact, this was my first dog too. Inside the first 30 days my puppy needed emergency surgery after ingesting something still unknown to date. The object was coiling around her colon and causing her high levels of pain etc. Her regular Vet Dr. & the staff at our Veterinary Hospital were superb...as usual.

Well that's where the "happy happy" feeling usually ends. NOT in this case! The ASPCA Pet Health policy did EXACTLY what they promised AND MORE. Once I sent in my claim:  (1) an ASPCA rep called to acknowledge they had my paperwork & processing had begun; (2) several other reps followed up to simply to ask how Luna was feeling, acting & healing; and (3) my reimbursement check, minus the obvious deductible, arrived in less then 14 business days.

Our furry babies are family, we adore them & they love us unconditionally. That said, it's an easy decision....when they need help, we are their sole means of help & we must be able to step up on their behalf. With ASPCA Pet Health Insurance on our side it's a no brainier. I truly hope this helps you make your final decision.

I'm the proud mama of the sweetest, most gentle Pit Bull ever. Luna, by the way, will begin training for Therapy Dog certification next month.

A Happy ASPCA Customer üêæ
title: FAR BETTER than imagined....

text: Easy to navigate website... Claims can be submitted on line. Good ... Why not great?  It took me few tries to submit the same claim on two different occasions...
title: Easy, quick way of submitting cldims

text: Every time my dog has recurring vet visits I always get a personal call asking how he is doing. The price is right and I genuinely feel like they care about his wellbeing. I'll be a customer for the duration of his life. It has saved us thousands over the course of his life: a knee surgery, the time he swallowed my underwear, getting his eye fixed after he poked it in a bush, the second time he poked his eye in a bush, and more. Well worth the money.
title: They really care about the wellbeing of my dog.

text: Every claim I've filed that was for covered services has been settled in 2 weeks or less.  Phone calls telling me the claim has been settled is a nice personal touch.,
title: Quick to resolve claims and never nitpicky about information needed to process them.

text:
've had this insurance on Max since he was 10 weeks old, he is now 8.  We've not had any really big claims in all these years and many years we had none.  Until now; he has been limping, spending 40% of the time on 3-legs.  I wanted to do everything I could to find out what is was incase it could be surgically fixed.  He may be eight, but he still has the energy of a 3-4 year old dog.  

My rates shot up over $100 a year.  Coincidence?  I doubt it.  I am seriously going to be shopping around as soon as I have the time...........

I feel I am being penalized and that is a crock of you know what?
title: being penalized

text: Wonderful insurance for pets.
title: Great pet insurance

text: I did not have a terrible experience with ASPCA insurance. The main reason why I left was because I was not happy with the level of coverage. When I signed up for 80%, I expected everything but 80% to be covered minus the deductible. Instead, they fail to mention the cap on allowable charges and then only pay 80% of that! That's outrageous and not clearly articulated in the policy, which I read. The reason why I would never reconsider acquiring a plan from the ASPCA is the incredibly rude and honestly nasty individual who I spoke to on the phone when I tried to cancel my policy. This woman was flippant in her responses, overly aggressive and inconsiderate. Instead of trying to sway me to stay, she merely chastised me for my decision. I would absolutely never reconsider ASPCA pet insurance and I would never recommend to anyone.
title: Not terrible but definitely can do better for the same price.

text: This company is not only reliable and quick with their reimbursements, but they are kind, thoughtful and genuine. When I lost my sweet dog prematurely 2.5 years ago the staff at ASPCA Pet Insurance called me and asked how I was doing.  They had seen the charges on my claim form that reflected my pups surgery and euthanasia and courtesy called me to share kind words and condolences. I have had this insurance for around 9-10 years and I recommend them to everyone. I have never had a bad experience, nor have I have dealt with an unpleasant or uninformed staff member. In case this reaches them, I would like to say, thank you. This insurance has given me confidence in some pretty tough situations because I always knew it had my pets best interest in mind. The staff have offered comfort in times where I was crying so hard they could barely understand me. I will continue to use this insurance as long as I have pets. Keep up the fantastic work!
title: Pet Insurance

text: They won't pay for prescription medicine in full because they say I can get it cheaper, I have not been able to get cheaper and I even work for a veterinarian.  When I asked where I can purchase it cheaper they said they cannot share that information, typical insurance racket.
title: Can't explain their benefits schedule

text: I love them but they could pay me for most bills
title: i like to do business with them. however they could pay me for some of my refund.

text: Excellent service and prompt
title: Excellent service

text: Fast claims great coverage ! Well priced plan !
title: Excellent service !

text: my dog required surgery. The representative s were professional, compassionate, and efficient. I filed my claim and was reimbursed rapidly. I would recommend them to anyone interested in pet insurance. Rachel milazzo
title: EXCELLENT SERVICE

text: My dog is normally pretty healthy, but this past December he had a run in with a car, which thankfully was just superficial. From there, it seemed as if it was one thing after the next sore legs, swollen foot, my poor guy. ASPCA handled our claims with efficiency and followed up with personal calls to check on how our dog was healing. We've had ASPCA insurance for some time and have been really fortunate with our guy up until now. It was great knowing that they were there when we needed them and felt that the coverage really paid off when we needed it most.
title: Glad to be covered

text:
My dog;  Benji is 13 years old. About 3 months ago, I was informed he had Kidney Failure. From that point on I've had to re-test his Kidney numbers weekly & then monthly. 
No one ever wants to need Pet Insurance, however having the ASPCA Pet Insurance plan has given me piece of mind. So I don't worry so much about paying the bill. Which gets quite costly!!
I do recommend ASPCA Pet Insurance for their emails to let me know the progress of my claim.
title: Benji's ASPCA Pet Insurance

text:
Buddy and Scooter live a really great life and they enjoy the peace of mind knowing that their owners have the right Pet Health Insurance for them!!
They manage to sleep peacefully for most of the day -- they know that if they get sick or injured their ASPCA Health Insurance is going to help their owners pay for their care.
Thank you ASPCA Pet Health Insurance!!  Scooter had quite a setback in February.  He is doing just fine now!!
title: Buddy and Scooter
